sense.def: the soul of a deceased person (especially insofar as it is endowed with a supernatural efficacy); spirit; deity

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUGE 08:04; SBBY 131; Jin 270; Huang 47; Fu 71; tr. Hawkes 114;

tls:text.tls:line: Riding a white turtle, he chases the spotted fishes.

sense.def: mount, ride in (a carriage, a boat etc); ride on (dragons on the clouds)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUGE 08:04; SBBY 131; Jin 270; Huang 47; Fu 71; tr. Hawkes 114;

tls:text.tls:line: Riding a white turtle, he chases the spotted fishes.

sense.def: white; of swords: blank, i.e. drawn; derived nominal usage

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUGE 08:04; SBBY 131; Jin 270; Huang 47; Fu 71; tr. Hawkes 114;

tls:text.tls:line: Riding a white turtle, he chases the spotted fishes.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUGE 08:04; SBBY 131; Jin 270; Huang 47; Fu 71; tr. Hawkes 114;

tls:text.tls:line: Riding a white turtle, he chases the spotted fishes.

sense.def: go after, chase (deer or fish etc); go in search of (something to eat etc)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUGE 08:04; SBBY 131; Jin 270; Huang 47; Fu 71; tr. Hawkes 114;

tls:text.tls:line: Riding a white turtle, he chases the spotted fishes.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUGE 08:04; SBBY 131; Jin 270; Huang 47; Fu 71; tr. Hawkes 114;

tls:text.tls:line: Let me play with you among the river's islets,

sense.def: rare and poetic: medium size island in a river; island

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUGE 09:01; SBBY 132; Jin 274; Huang 49; Fu 72; tr. Hawkes 115;

tls:text.tls:line: 1 There seems to be someone in the fold of the mountain

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUGE 09:01; SBBY 132; Jin 274; Huang 49; Fu 72; tr. Hawkes 115;

tls:text.tls:line: With eyes that hold laugther and a smile of pearly brightness:

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUGE 09:01; SBBY 132; Jin 274; Huang 49; Fu 72; tr. Hawkes 115;

tls:text.tls:line: With eyes that hold laugther and a smile of pearly brightness:

sense.def: smile in a beguiling manner (of women)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUGE 09:01; SBBY 132; Jin 274; Huang 49; Fu 72; tr. Hawkes 115;

tls:text.tls:line: 'Lady, your allurements show that you desire me.'

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUGE 09:01; SBBY 132; Jin 274; Huang 49; Fu 72; tr. Hawkes 115;

tls:text.tls:line: 'Lady, your allurements show that you desire me.'

sense.def: be emotionally utterly devoted to (a person), feel and show naive love and eager admiration (like a small child for its parents); be enamoured of, love and admire; be full of naive admiration; fall in love with, fall for; show distant affection for and emulate; admire distantly

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUGE 09:02; SBBY 133; Jin 274; Huang 49; Fu 72; tr. Hawkes 115;

tls:text.tls:line: Her cloak of stone-orchids, her belt of asarum:

sense.def: read pī: wear (cloth); bear (shield etc); abstractly, occasionally: bear (a bad name etc)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUGE 09:03; SBBY 134; Jin 274; Huang 49; Fu 72; tr. Hawkes 116;

tls:text.tls:line: 'I am in the dense bamboo grove, which never sees the sunlight,

sense.def: I (particularly from Warring States onwards: "I personally" rarely physically: "I purely physically (was injured etc) )

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUGE 09:03; SBBY 134; Jin 274; Huang 49; Fu 72; tr. Hawkes 116;

tls:text.tls:line: 'I am in the dense bamboo grove, which never sees the sunlight,

sense.def: dark and shady, dark and secluded (like a shadowy valley); overgrown

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUGE 09:03; SBBY 134; Jin 274; Huang 49; Fu 72; tr. Hawkes 116;

tls:text.tls:line: Solitary she stands, upon the mountain's summit:

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUGE 09:04; SBBY 134; Jin 277; Huang 49; Fu 73; tr. Hawkes 116;

tls:text.tls:line: When the east wind blows up, the goddess sends down her showers.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUGE 09:04; SBBY 134; Jin 277; Huang 49; Fu 73; tr. Hawkes 116;

tls:text.tls:line: 15 Dallying with the Fair One, I forget about returning.

sense.def: paraphrastic: the spiritual beautiful one> the ruler

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUGE 09:04; SBBY 134; Jin 277; Huang 49; Fu 73; tr. Hawkes 116;

tls:text.tls:line: What flowers can I deck myself with, so late in the year?

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUGE 09:05; SBBY 135; Jin 277; Huang 50; Fu 73; tr. Hawkes 116;

tls:text.tls:line: I shall pluck the thrice-flowering herb among the mountains,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUGE 10:01; SBBY 137; Jin 2i3; Huang 51; Fu 74; tr. Hawkes 117;

tls:text.tls:line: 1 Grasping our great shields and wearing our hide armour,

sense.def: hold in one's hands and be in charge of; hold and carry along (objects with or without a handle)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUGE 10:01; SBBY 137; Jin 2i3; Huang 51; Fu 74; tr. Hawkes 117;

tls:text.tls:line: 1 Grasping our great shields and wearing our hide armour,

sense.def: lance with a knife or axe at the top, battle axe with one edge, dagger-axe

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUGE 10:01; SBBY 137; Jin 2i3; Huang 51; Fu 74; tr. Hawkes 117;

tls:text.tls:line: Our banners darken the sky; the enemy teem like clouds:

tls:text.tls:srcline: 凌余陣兮躐余行，凌休陣兮躐余行，

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUGE 10:02; SBBY 138; Jin 2i3; Huang 52; Fu 74; tr. Hawkes 117;

tls:text.tls:line: 5 They dash on our lines; they trample our ranks down.

tls:text.tls:srcline: 凌余陣兮躐余行，凌休陣兮躐余行，

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUGE 10:02; SBBY 138; Jin 2i3; Huang 52; Fu 74; tr. Hawkes 117;

tls:text.tls:line: 5 They dash on our lines; they trample our ranks down.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUGE 10:02; SBBY 138; Jin 2i3; Huang 52; Fu 74; tr. Hawkes 117;

tls:text.tls:line: The left horse has fallen, the right one is wounded.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUGE 10:02; SBBY 138; Jin 2i3; Huang 52; Fu 74; tr. Hawkes 117;

tls:text.tls:line: The left horse has fallen, the right one is wounded.

sense.def: with a sword; by a sword

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUGE 10:02; SBBY 138; Jin 2i3; Huang 52; Fu 74; tr. Hawkes 117;

tls:text.tls:line: The wheels are embedded, the foursome entangled:

sense.def: the pair of, the two, both 兩手，兩目，兩耳

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUGE 10:02; SBBY 138; Jin 2i3; Huang 52; Fu 74; tr. Hawkes 117;

tls:text.tls:line: Seize the jade drumstick and beat the sounding drum!

sense.def: knock against (mostly drums but also bells) so as to produce a sound; knock (at a gate)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUGE 10:02; SBBY 138; Jin 2i3; Huang 52; Fu 74; tr. Hawkes 117;

tls:text.tls:line: The time is against us: the gods are angry.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUGE 10:02; SBBY 138; Jin 2i3; Huang 52; Fu 74; tr. Hawkes 117;

tls:text.tls:line: The time is against us: the gods are angry.

sense.def: the soul of a deceased person (especially insofar as it is endowed with a supernatural efficacy); spirit; deity

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUGE 10:03; SBBY 139; Jin 286; Huang 52; Fu 74; tr. Hawkes 117;

tls:text.tls:line: Far, far away they lie, on the level plain,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUGE 10:03; SBBY 139; Jin 286; Huang 52; Fu 74; tr. Hawkes 117;

tls:text.tls:line: Their long swords at their belts, clasping their Qín bows,

sense.def: carry (any object, sword) on belt; carry along, take along

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUGE 10:03; SBBY 139; Jin 286; Huang 52; Fu 74; tr. Hawkes 117;

tls:text.tls:line: Head from body sundered: but their hearts could not be vanquished.

sense.def: body as a whole; especially the main trunk as opposed to the head; body as embodying the person

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUGE 10:04; SBBY 139; Jin 286; Huang 52; Fu 75; tr. Hawkes 117;

tls:text.tls:line: Strong to the last, they could not be dishonored.

sense.def: tough, resilient (of humans); firm in moral convictions

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUGE 10:04; SBBY 139; Jin 286; Huang 52; Fu 75; tr. Hawkes 117;

tls:text.tls:line: Strong to the last, they could not be dishonored.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUGE 10:04; SBBY 139; Jin 286; Huang 52; Fu 75; tr. Hawkes 117;

tls:text.tls:line: Their bodies may have died, but their souls are living:

sense.def: often reflexive: one's (own) person; one's (own) person and character; the Self; personality (as something cultivated by the gentleman); the character

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUGE 10:04; SBBY 139; Jin 286; Huang 52; Fu 75; tr. Hawkes 117;

tls:text.tls:line: Their bodies may have died, but their souls are living:

sense.def: be full of vital and metaphysical energy

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUGE 10:04; SBBY 139; Jin 286; Huang 52; Fu 75; tr. Hawkes 117;

tls:text.tls:line: Heroes among the shades their valiant souls will be.

sense.def: ghost of a deceased person or creature, spirit of a feature of nature

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUGE 10:04; SBBY 139; Jin 286; Huang 52; Fu 75; tr. Hawkes 117;

tls:text.tls:line: Heroes among the shades their valiant souls will be.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUGE 11:01; SBBY 140; Jin 289; Huang 53; Fu 76; tr. Hawkes 118;

tls:text.tls:line: The rites are accomplished to the beating of the drums;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUGE 11:01; SBBY 140; Jin 289; Huang 53; Fu 76; tr. Hawkes 118;

tls:text.tls:line: The rites are accomplished to the beating of the drums;

sense.def: beat the drum for an attack

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUGE 11:01; SBBY 140; Jin 289; Huang 53; Fu 76; tr. Hawkes 118;

tls:text.tls:line: Lovely maidens sing their song, slow and solemnly.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUGE 11:01; SBBY 140; Jin 289; Huang 53; Fu 76; tr. Hawkes 118;

tls:text.tls:line: Lovely maidens sing their song, slow and solemnly.

sense.def: lead the singing, be the song-leader

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:01; SBBY 144; Jin 292; Huang 55; Fu 77; tr. Hawkes 127; You 10;

tls:text.tls:line: Heavenly Questions

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:01; SBBY 144; Jin 292; Huang 55; Fu 77; tr. Hawkes 127; You 10;

tls:text.tls:line: of the far-off, ancient beginning of things?

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:01; SBBY 144; Jin 292; Huang 55; Fu 77; tr. Hawkes 127; You 10;

tls:text.tls:line: before the sky above and the earth below had taken shape?

sense.def: to submit to a close examination; to investigate strictly Shiji: 考信

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:01; SBBY 144; Jin 292; Huang 55; Fu 77; tr. Hawkes 127; You 10;

tls:text.tls:line: about the chaos of insubstantial forms?

sense.def: get an idea of, get any idea of; get wind of, notice

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:03; SBBY 146; Jin 293; Huang 56; Fu 77; tr. Hawkes 127; You 27;

tls:text.tls:line: out the ninefold heavens?

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:03; SBBY 146; Jin 293; Huang 56; Fu 77; tr. Hawkes 127; You 27;

tls:text.tls:line: out the ninefold heavens?

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:03; SBBY 146; Jin 293; Huang 56; Fu 77; tr. Hawkes 127; You 27;

tls:text.tls:line: Where were the circling chords fastened,

sense.def: be tied to, be fastened on to

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:04; SBBY 147; Jin 293; Huang 56; Fu 77; tr. Hawkes 127; You 40;

tls:text.tls:line: who knows their number?

sense.def: quantity; Anzahl; (magical) number e.g. 用六數 "uses the number six; use sextuplets of things".

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:06; SBBY 148; Jin 293; Huang 56; Fu 77; tr. Hawkes 127; You 51;

tls:text.tls:line: from the dawn until the time of darkness,

sense.def: until (place or time); by the time of CHECK EXAMPLES ETC

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:07; SBBY 149; Jin 293; Huang 56; Fu 77; tr. Hawkes 127; You 56;

tls:text.tls:line: which causes it to grow once more after its death?

sense.def: come to life, come to grow (again) 又育 "bring to life again"

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:11; SBBY 151; Jin 307; Huang 58; Fu 77; tr. Hawkes 128; You 92;

tls:text.tls:line: Long he lay cast off on Feather Mountain:

sense.def: for a fairly long time; all the time CC 永歎; forever

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:11; SBBY 151; Jin 307; Huang 58; Fu 77; tr. Hawkes 128; You 92;

tls:text.tls:line: how was he transformed?

sense.def: change and be transformed, undergo all sorts of changes and transformations

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:11; SBBY 151; Jin 307; Huang 58; Fu 77; tr. Hawkes 128; You 92;

tls:text.tls:line: and carried on the work of his father.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:13; SBBY 152; Jin 307; Huang 59; Fu 77; tr. Hawkes 128; You 108;

tls:text.tls:line: 33 What did Gǔn plan

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:13; SBBY 152; Jin 307; Huang 59; Fu 77; tr. Hawkes 128; You 108;

tls:text.tls:line: did the earth sink down towards the south-east?

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:14; SBBY 153; Jin 318; Huang 59; Fu 77; tr. Hawkes 128; You 114;

tls:text.tls:line: Why are the lands of the earth dry

sense.def: the nine regions of the world 揚州，梁州，青州，冀州，雍州，豫州，徐州，兗州，荊州

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:15; SBBY 154; Jin 318; Huang 59; Fu 77; tr. Hawkes 128; You 122;

tls:text.tls:line: What are the distances

tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:16; SBBY 155; Jin 319; Huang 60; Fu 78; tr. Hawkes 128; You 130;

tls:text.tls:line: What land does the sun not shine on

sense.def: reach as far as (not by walking), lead to

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:16; SBBY 155; Jin 319; Huang 60; Fu 78; tr. Hawkes 128; You 130;

tls:text.tls:line: Where is the stone forest?

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:17; SBBY 157; Jin 319; Huang 60; Fu 78; tr. Hawkes 128; You 145;

tls:text.tls:line: Where are the hornless dragons

tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:17; SBBY 157; Jin 319; Huang 60; Fu 78; tr. Hawkes 128; You 145;

tls:text.tls:line: Where is the great serpent with nine heads

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:17; SBBY 157; Jin 319; Huang 60; Fu 78; tr. Hawkes 128; You 145;

tls:text.tls:line: Where is the great serpent with nine heads

sense.def: GUOYU: (specifically) small and often poisonous snake; viper; generally: snake

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:18; SBBY 159; Jin 319; Huang 60; Fu 78; tr. Hawkes 128; You 160;

tls:text.tls:line: How does the snake that can swallow an elephant

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:18; SBBY 159; Jin 319; Huang 60; Fu 78; tr. Hawkes 128; You 160;

tls:text.tls:line: How does the snake that can swallow an elephant

sense.def: gulp down (of liquids); swallow (food, or even a pearl); be large enough to be able to swallow

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:18; SBBY 159; Jin 319; Huang 60; Fu 78; tr. Hawkes 128; You 160;

tls:text.tls:line: How does the snake that can swallow an elephant

tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:18; SBBY 159; Jin 319; Huang 60; Fu 78; tr. Hawkes 128; You 160;

tls:text.tls:line: Where is the Black Water that dyes the feet,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:18; SBBY 159; Jin 319; Huang 60; Fu 78; tr. Hawkes 128; You 160;

tls:text.tls:line: Where is the Black Water that dyes the feet,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:18; SBBY 159; Jin 319; Huang 60; Fu 78; tr. Hawkes 128; You 160;

tls:text.tls:line: Where is the Black Water that dyes the feet,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:18; SBBY 159; Jin 319; Huang 60; Fu 78; tr. Hawkes 128; You 160;

tls:text.tls:line: The folk there put death off for many years:

sense.def: consecutive 延年 "for years on end"

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:18; SBBY 159; Jin 319; Huang 60; Fu 78; tr. Hawkes 128; You 160;

tls:text.tls:line: Where does the man-fish live?

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:19; SBBY 160; Jin 319; Huang 60; Fu 78; tr. Hawkes 129; You 171;

tls:text.tls:line: why did the ravens shed their feathers?

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:20; SBBY 161; Jin 338; Huang 62; Fu 78; tr. Hawkes 129; You 177;

tls:text.tls:line: How did he get that maid of Tú-shān

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:20; SBBY 161; Jin 338; Huang 62; Fu 78; tr. Hawkes 129; You 177;

tls:text.tls:line: and lie with her in Tái-sāng?

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:20; SBBY 161; Jin 338; Huang 62; Fu 78; tr. Hawkes 129; You 177;

tls:text.tls:line: and her body had issue.

sense.def: it is N that PREDs (very much like 實)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:21; SBBY 162; Jin 338; Huang 63; Fu 78; tr. Hawkes 129; You 188;

tls:text.tls:line: and did no harm to his person.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:22; SBBY 163; Jin 338; Huang 63; Fu 78; tr. Hawkes 129; You 195;

tls:text.tls:line: Why, if he was so good a son, did he kill his mother,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:23; SBBY 164; Jin 338; Huang 63; Fu 78; tr. Hawkes 129; You 212;

tls:text.tls:line: to overcome the calamities of the people below.

sense.def: to change by way of elimination or exclusion (perhaps originally by removing the hair off the skin, or by flaying); avert; to change and replace without formal authority; undergo an unexpected change; make a formally unlicenced change

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:23; SBBY 164; Jin 338; Huang 63; Fu 78; tr. Hawkes 129; You 212;

tls:text.tls:line: Why then did he shoot the River Lord

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:23; SBBY 164; Jin 338; Huang 63; Fu 78; tr. Hawkes 129; You 212;

tls:text.tls:line: he shot the Great Swine.

sense.def: this aforementioned N; the preceding N (is the one the SUBJECT VERBS) 敗是求 "it is defeat that you have sought"

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:25; SBBY 166; Jin 355; Huang 64; Fu 78; tr. Hawkes 129; You 227;

tls:text.tls:line: how did the shamans bring him back to life?

tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:25; SBBY 166; Jin 355; Huang 64; Fu 78; tr. Hawkes 129; You 227;

tls:text.tls:line: and the rushlands became a place of husbandry.

sense.def: this aforementioned N; the preceding N (is the one the SUBJECT VERBS) 敗是求 "it is defeat that you have sought"

tls:text.tls:line: Where did Yì get that goodly herb,

tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:26; SBBY 167; Jin 355; Huang 64; Fu 78; tr. Hawkes 130; You 240;

tls:text.tls:line: Where did Yì get that goodly herb,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:26; SBBY 167; Jin 355; Huang 64; Fu 78; tr. Hawkes 130; You 240;

tls:text.tls:line: Where did Yì get that goodly herb,

sense.def: medicine, medication; (dig for) medicinal roots, herbs or mushrooms

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:29; SBBY 169; Jin 355; Huang 65; Fu 78; tr. Hawkes 130; You 258;

tls:text.tls:line: and she herself meet the end that was meant for him?

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:31; SBBY 170; Jin 368; Huang 67; Fu 79; tr. Hawkes 130; You 273;

tls:text.tls:line: if he did not tell his family?

tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:33; SBBY 171; Jin 368; Huang 68; Fu 79; tr. Hawkes 130; You 279;

tls:text.tls:line: By what law was Nǔ Wā

sense.def: be installed so as to become: be installed as; get oneself established as

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:33; SBBY 171; Jin 368; Huang 68; Fu 79; tr. Hawkes 130; You 279;

tls:text.tls:line: did she fashion the different creatures?

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:33; SBBY 171; Jin 368; Huang 68; Fu 79; tr. Hawkes 130; You 279;

tls:text.tls:line: did she fashion the different creatures?

tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:33; SBBY 171; Jin 368; Huang 68; Fu 79; tr. Hawkes 130; You 279;

tls:text.tls:line: did she fashion the different creatures?

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:34; SBBY 172; Jin 368; Huang 68; Fu 79; tr. Hawkes 130; You 2i4;

tls:text.tls:line: did Shùn's brother come to no harm?

sense.def: close to third-person pronoun: an individual; (with contrasting noun in parallel phrase: 其身the person; a person (physically))

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:35; SBBY 172; Jin 368; Huang 68; Fu 79; tr. Hawkes 130; You 287;

tls:text.tls:line: and stayed in Nán-yuè.

sense.def: this aforementioned N; the preceding N (is the one the SUBJECT VERBS) 敗是求 "it is defeat that you have sought"

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:35; SBBY 172; Jin 368; Huang 68; Fu 79; tr. Hawkes 130; You 287;

tls:text.tls:line: Who would have thought to find the two princes

sense.def: here, this place (also non-referential: 有人於斯) idiom 於斯乎

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:35; SBBY 172; Jin 368; Huang 68; Fu 79; tr. Hawkes 130; You 287;

tls:text.tls:line: in that place?

sense.def: the pair of, the two, both 兩手，兩目，兩耳

tls:text.tls:line: the high lord was feasted.

sense.def: this aforementioned N; the preceding N (is the one the SUBJECT VERBS) 敗是求 "it is defeat that you have sought"

tls:text.tls:line: the high lord was feasted.

sense.def: OBI 3: SHI 175: regale (especially the spirits with sacrificial food, also honoured guests), provide a large-scale feast for; invite to an elaborate feast See 享

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:36; SBBY 173; Jin 368; Huang 68; Fu 79; tr. Hawkes 131; You 294;

tls:text.tls:line: The high lord came down and looked about,

tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:36; SBBY 173; Jin 368; Huang 68; Fu 79; tr. Hawkes 131; You 294;

sense.def: look at and enjoy things, look around; behold 觀者"beholder"

sense.def: make the acquantance of, get together with

tls:text.tls:line: When the swallow brought his gift, why was the maiden glad?

tls:text.tls:line: When the swallow brought his gift, why was the maiden glad?

tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:38; SBBY 174; Jin 379; Huang 69; Fu 79; tr. Hawkes 131; You 305;

tls:text.tls:line: His father was a goodly man.

sense.def: it is N that PREDs (very much like 實)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:39; SBBY 175; Jin 379; Huang 69; Fu 79; tr. Hawkes 131; You 321;

tls:text.tls:line: When they struck the bed, he had already left the chamber:

sense.def: a bed 於床 and not necessarily 於床上

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:39; SBBY 175; Jin 379; Huang 69; Fu 79; tr. Hawkes 131; You 321;

tls:text.tls:line: how did he meet his fate?

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:39; SBBY 175; Jin 379; Huang 69; Fu 79; tr. Hawkes 131; You 321;

tls:text.tls:line: How did he get back those oxherds and oxen?

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:39; SBBY 175; Jin 379; Huang 69; Fu 79; tr. Hawkes 131; You 321;

tls:text.tls:line: How did he go about there dispensing gifts,

sense.def: go to a contextually determinate place and V, set out to V; be on one's way to (with a verbal (or subjectless sentential, if one prefers) object) 往拜之

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:39; SBBY 175; Jin 379; Huang 69; Fu 79; tr. Hawkes 131; You 321;

tls:text.tls:line: How did he go about there dispensing gifts,

sense.def: go about V-ing in a planned deliberate manner

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:39; SBBY 175; Jin 379; Huang 69; Fu 79; tr. Hawkes 131; You 321;

tls:text.tls:line: How did he go about there dispensing gifts,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:39; SBBY 175; Jin 379; Huang 69; Fu 79; tr. Hawkes 131; You 321;

tls:text.tls:line: Dark Wēi followed in his brother's footsteps

sense.def: follow (the bank of a river); follow along; follow the course of; pass through in following one's course

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:40; SBBY 176; Jin 379; Huang 69; Fu 79; tr. Hawkes 131; You 336;

tls:text.tls:line: The Dark Man lay with her adulterously

sense.def: shoulder to shoulder, together, side by side; momentaneously; at the same time; 十日並出

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:40; SBBY 176; Jin 379; Huang 69; Fu 79; tr. Hawkes 131; You 336;

tls:text.tls:line: The Dark Man lay with her adulterously

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:40; SBBY 176; Jin 379; Huang 69; Fu 79; tr. Hawkes 131; You 336;

tls:text.tls:line: Why, after so much falsehood and treachery,

sense.def: change and be transformed, undergo all sorts of changes and transformations

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:40; SBBY 176; Jin 379; Huang 69; Fu 79; tr. Hawkes 131; You 336;

tls:text.tls:line: was it given to his posterity to flourish?

sense.def: meet (the right object); be exposed to (the right person, times, etc)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:40; SBBY 176; Jin 379; Huang 69; Fu 79; tr. Hawkes 131; You 336;

tls:text.tls:line: was it given to his posterity to flourish?

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:41; SBBY 177; Jin 379; Huang 69; Fu 79; tr. Hawkes 131; You 347;

tls:text.tls:line: and win a goodly queen?

sense.def: this aforementioned N; the preceding N (is the one the SUBJECT VERBS) 敗是求 "it is defeat that you have sought"

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:42; SBBY 178; Jin 379; Huang 70; Fu 79; tr. Hawkes 131; You 350;

tls:text.tls:line: for what crime was he shut up there?

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:42; SBBY 178; Jin 379; Huang 70; Fu 79; tr. Hawkes 131; You 350;

tls:text.tls:line: with impatient heart against his lord king?

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:43; SBBY 178; Jin 391; Huang 72; Fu 79; tr. Hawkes 131; You 358;

tls:text.tls:line: When Zhòu's body was beheaded and mutilated,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:43; SBBY 178; Jin 391; Huang 72; Fu 79; tr. Hawkes 131; You 358;

tls:text.tls:line: When Zhòu's body was beheaded and mutilated,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:45; SBBY 180; Jin 391; Huang 73; Fu 79; tr. Hawkes 132; You 375;

tls:text.tls:line: when he went to the South Land?

sense.def: make the acquantance of, get together with

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:47; SBBY 1i1; Jin 391; Huang 73; Fu 79; tr. Hawkes 132; You 3i2;

tls:text.tls:line: when he got that Bāo Sì? [and how did he?CH]

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:48; SBBY 1i2; Jin 391; Huang 73; Fu 80; tr. Hawkes 132; You 386;

tls:text.tls:line: Heaven in its dispensations veers first to one side and then to the other.

sense.def: Fate (as a personified or quasi-personified agent)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:48; SBBY 1i2; Jin 391; Huang 73; Fu 80; tr. Hawkes 132; You 386;

tls:text.tls:line: yet in the end his body was destroyed.

sense.def: contrastive: himself; oneself; the person him/herself (also: 身雖無能)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:49; SBBY 1i3; Jin 391; Huang 74; Fu 80; tr. Hawkes 132; You 389;

tls:text.tls:line: 143 Who was it that led

sense.def: person; formal or poetic: his person

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:49; SBBY 1i3; Jin 391; Huang 74; Fu 80; tr. Hawkes 132; You 389;

tls:text.tls:line: Why did he hate his ministers

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:49; SBBY 1i3; Jin 391; Huang 74; Fu 80; tr. Hawkes 132; You 389;

tls:text.tls:line: and let flatterers and backbiters serve him?

sense.def: this aforementioned N; the preceding N (is the one the SUBJECT VERBS) 敗是求 "it is defeat that you have sought"

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:50; SBBY 1i3; Jin 391; Huang 74; Fu 80; tr. Hawkes 132; You 392;

tls:text.tls:line: but Jī Zǐ feigned madness.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:51; SBBY 1i4; Jin 403; Huang 74; Fu 80; tr. Hawkes 132; You 396;

tls:text.tls:line: When he was left out on the ice,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:52; SBBY 185; Jin 403; Huang 74; Fu 80; tr. Hawkes 133; You 406;

tls:text.tls:line: 153 Lord Chāng abandoned his own title

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:52; SBBY 185; Jin 403; Huang 74; Fu 80; tr. Hawkes 133; You 406;

tls:text.tls:line: and consented to be a sheperd of the marshes for King Zhòu.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:52; SBBY 185; Jin 403; Huang 74; Fu 80; tr. Hawkes 133; You 406;

tls:text.tls:line: Why then did he remove his altars from Qí

sense.def: sacrificial mound and pole used for sacrifices to the spirits of the land

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:52; SBBY 185; Jin 403; Huang 74; Fu 80; tr. Hawkes 133; You 406;

tls:text.tls:line: and claim heaven's mandate to supplant Yīn?

sense.def: be ordered to V by a contextually determinate person

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:54; SBBY 186; Jin 403; Huang 75; Fu 80; tr. Hawkes 133; You 413;

tls:text.tls:line: the Lord of the West declared it to heaven.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:55; SBBY 187; Jin 403; Huang 75; Fu 80; tr. Hawkes 133; You 416;

tls:text.tls:line: how did Chāng know him?

sense.def: recognise, be familiar with, know (a person); be acquainted with; recognize the identity of

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:56; SBBY 187; Jin 403; Huang 75; Fu 80; tr. Hawkes 133; You 418;

tls:text.tls:line: why was he in such a hurry?

sense.def: be keen on; deal with with urgency; seek with urgency, be extremely eager after; feel an urgent concern for; be urgently concerned with 急利甚

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:57; SBBY 187; Jin 410; Huang 75; Fu 80; tr. Hawkes 133; You 421;

tls:text.tls:line: 163 Why did Bó Lín hang himself?

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:57; SBBY 187; Jin 410; Huang 75; Fu 80; tr. Hawkes 133; You 421;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:57; SBBY 187; Jin 410; Huang 75; Fu 80; tr. Hawkes 133; You 421;

tls:text.tls:line: who was so afraid?

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:58; SBBY 188; Jin 410; Huang 75; Fu 80; tr. Hawkes 133; You 426;

tls:text.tls:line: 165 When High God in heaven confers his mandate,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:59; SBBY 188; Jin 410; Huang 75; Fu 80; tr. Hawkes 133; You 429;

tls:text.tls:line: but afterwards he made him his counsellor.

sense.def: assistant; helper; senior aide; most important minister

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:60; SBBY 189; Jin 410; Huang 75; Fu 80; tr. Hawkes 133; You 433;

tls:text.tls:line: How did he make strong his might,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:60; SBBY 189; Jin 410; Huang 75; Fu 80; tr. Hawkes 133; You 433;

tls:text.tls:line: How did he make strong his might,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:60; SBBY 189; Jin 410; Huang 75; Fu 80; tr. Hawkes 133; You 433;

tls:text.tls:line: so that he could spread his authority abroad?

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:62; SBBY 190; Jin 410; Huang 76; Fu 80; tr. Hawkes 134; You 442;

tls:text.tls:line: Wasps and ants have a mean fate:

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:64; SBBY 190; Jin 410; Huang 76; Fu 80; tr. Hawkes 134; You 453;

tls:text.tls:line: 177 The elder brother had a hunting-dog.

sense.def: biting, prone to biting; German: bissig

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:65; SBBY 191; Jin 419; Huang 79; Fu 80; tr. Hawkes 134; You 457;

tls:text.tls:line: 179 Towards evening there was thunder and lightning.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:65; SBBY 191; Jin 419; Huang 79; Fu 80; tr. Hawkes 134; You 457;

tls:text.tls:line: 179 Towards evening there was thunder and lightning.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:66; SBBY 191; Jin 419; Huang 79; Fu 80; tr. Hawkes 134; You 462;

tls:text.tls:line: 1ī What was the king's sorrow

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:67; SBBY 192; Jin 419; Huang 80; Fu 80; tr. Hawkes 134; You 467;

tls:text.tls:line: when he awoke to the error of his ways?

sense.def: get a clear vision of, come to understand; understand the significance of; oappreciate properly; become enlightened to

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:67; SBBY 192; Jin 419; Huang 80; Fu 80; tr. Hawkes 134; You 467;

tls:text.tls:line: when he awoke to the error of his ways?

sense.def: minor transgression; wrongdoing, wrong practice; formal offense

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:67; SBBY 192; Jin 419; Huang 80; Fu 80; tr. Hawkes 134; You 467;

tls:text.tls:line: when he awoke to the error of his ways?

sense.def: change one's ways; "turn over a new leaf"

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:67; SBBY 192; Jin 419; Huang 80; Fu 80; tr. Hawkes 134; You 467;

tls:text.tls:line: why were we so long defeated?

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:67; SBBY 192; Jin 419; Huang 80; Fu 80; tr. Hawkes 134; You 467;

tls:text.tls:line: why were we so long defeated?

sense.def: this aforementioned N; the preceding N (is the one the SUBJECT VERBS) 敗是求 "it is defeat that you have sought"

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:68; SBBY 192; Jin 419; Huang 80; Fu 80; tr. Hawkes 134; You 471;

tls:text.tls:line: 185 Round the village they went and through the altars until they came to the holy mounds.

sense.def: sacrificial mound and pole used for sacrifices to the spirits of the land

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:68; SBBY 192; Jin 419; Huang 80; Fu 80; tr. Hawkes 134; You 471;

tls:text.tls:line: 185 Round the village they went and through the altars until they came to the holy mounds.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC TIANWEN 01:69; SBBY 192; Jin 419; Huang 80; Fu 80; tr. Hawkes 134; You 475;

tls:text.tls:line: and seized kingship for himself,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:01; SBBY 197; Jin 438; Huang i2; Fu 95; tr. Hawkes 156;

tls:text.tls:line: To vent my wrath and tell my pent-up thoughts.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:02; SBBY 198; Jin 438; Huang i2; Fu 95; tr. Hawkes 156;

tls:text.tls:line: I forgot to fawn and simper; I turned my back on the crowd,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:02; SBBY 198; Jin 438; Huang i2; Fu 95; tr. Hawkes 156;

tls:text.tls:line: I forgot to fawn and simper; I turned my back on the crowd,

sense.def: (manage to) please through an affable appearance, curry favour with; beguile

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:02; SBBY 198; Jin 438; Huang i2; Fu 95; tr. Hawkes 156;

tls:text.tls:line: Awaiting my prince in his wisdom to know the true from the false;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:04; SBBY 199; Jin 438; Huang i2; Fu 95; tr. Hawkes 156;

tls:text.tls:line: 17 My loyalty put my prince first and my own life after;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:04; SBBY 199; Jin 438; Huang i2; Fu 95; tr. Hawkes 156;

tls:text.tls:line: And because of this, I earned the crowd's enmity.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:04; SBBY 199; Jin 438; Huang i2; Fu 95; tr. Hawkes 156;

tls:text.tls:line: And that, too, was a thing that the mob abhorred.

sense.def: regard as an enemy of hostile competitor> abhor; feel enmity towards, feel hostile towards

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:04; SBBY 199; Jin 438; Huang i2; Fu 95; tr. Hawkes 156;

tls:text.tls:line: But I see that to serve with all one's heart, careless of all things else,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:05; SBBY 200; Jin 446; Huang i3; Fu 95; tr. Hawkes 157;

tls:text.tls:line: Forgetful of lowly rank and poverty.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:05; SBBY 200; Jin 446; Huang i3; Fu 95; tr. Hawkes 157;

tls:text.tls:line: Sure, this was not the return that in my heart I looked for.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:05; SBBY 200; Jin 446; Huang i3; Fu 95; tr. Hawkes 157;

tls:text.tls:line: Sure, this was not the return that in my heart I looked for.

sense.def: my heart> I, in my heart

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:06; SBBY 201; Jin 446; Huang i3; Fu 95; tr. Hawkes 157;

tls:text.tls:line: 33 I was charged with many crimes; I met with many a slander;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:06; SBBY 201; Jin 446; Huang i3; Fu 95; tr. Hawkes 157;

tls:text.tls:line: 33 I was charged with many crimes; I met with many a slander;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:06; SBBY 201; Jin 446; Huang i3; Fu 95; tr. Hawkes 157;

tls:text.tls:line: 33 I was charged with many crimes; I met with many a slander;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:06; SBBY 201; Jin 446; Huang i3; Fu 95; tr. Hawkes 157;

tls:text.tls:line: 33 I was charged with many crimes; I met with many a slander;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:06; SBBY 201; Jin 446; Huang i3; Fu 95; tr. Hawkes 157;

tls:text.tls:line: My feelings were stifled and could not find expression,

sense.def: real inner state; innermost feelings; real inner feelings; basic feelings; basic loyalties; sentiment

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:06; SBBY 201; Jin 446; Huang i3; Fu 95; tr. Hawkes 157;

tls:text.tls:line: My feelings were stifled and could not find expression,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:06; SBBY 201; Jin 446; Huang i3; Fu 95; tr. Hawkes 157;

tls:text.tls:line: Heavy with sorrow, I waited irresolutely;

sense.def: I (particularly from Warring States onwards: "I personally" rarely physically: "I purely physically (was injured etc) )

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:06; SBBY 201; Jin 446; Huang i3; Fu 95; tr. Hawkes 157;

tls:text.tls:line: But none cared to examine what lay within my heart.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:06; SBBY 201; Jin 446; Huang i3; Fu 95; tr. Hawkes 157;

tls:text.tls:line: But none cared to examine what lay within my heart.

sense.def: real underlying attitude; innermost genuine feelings

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:07; SBBY 202; Jin 446; Huang i3; Fu 95; tr. Hawkes 157;

tls:text.tls:line: 41 If I left and retired into silence, then no one could ever know;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:07; SBBY 202; Jin 446; Huang i3; Fu 95; tr. Hawkes 157;

tls:text.tls:line: And if I went in and shouted, still no one would hear my cries.

sense.def: preposed object [relevant object cases must be moved here]

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:08; SBBY 202; Jin 451; Huang i3; Fu 95; tr. Hawkes 157;

tls:text.tls:line: 41 Once I dreamt that I climbed up to the heavens,

sense.def: I (particularly from Warring States onwards: "I personally" rarely physically: "I purely physically (was injured etc) )

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:08; SBBY 202; Jin 451; Huang i3; Fu 95; tr. Hawkes 157;

tls:text.tls:line: 41 Once I dreamt that I climbed up to the heavens,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:08; SBBY 202; Jin 451; Huang i3; Fu 95; tr. Hawkes 157;

tls:text.tls:line: But when my soul had reached half-way, it could go no farther.

sense.def: male soul which returns to heaven;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:08; SBBY 202; Jin 451; Huang i3; Fu 95; tr. Hawkes 157;

tls:text.tls:line: But when my soul had reached half-way, it could go no farther.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:08; SBBY 202; Jin 451; Huang i3; Fu 95; tr. Hawkes 157;

tls:text.tls:line: He said, 'Your ambition aspires, but will find no helpers;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:09; SBBY 203; Jin 452; Huang i4; Fu 95; tr. Hawkes 157;

tls:text.tls:line: 51 It is true that 'many tounges can make metal molten':

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:09; SBBY 203; Jin 452; Huang i4; Fu 95; tr. Hawkes 157;

tls:text.tls:line: Pure metal was I at first, and yet I have come to this pass.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:09; SBBY 203; Jin 452; Huang i4; Fu 95; tr. Hawkes 157;

tls:text.tls:line: Pure metal was I at first, and yet I have come to this pass.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:09; SBBY 203; Jin 452; Huang i4; Fu 95; tr. Hawkes 157;

tls:text.tls:line: Why then should I not alter my high intent?

sense.def: effect a change on something from a original state, typically, but not always, from a commendable, constant or ordinary state

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:09; SBBY 203; Jin 452; Huang i4; Fu 95; tr. Hawkes 157;

tls:text.tls:line: Why then should I not alter my high intent?

sense.def: this 此說之難"These difficulties with persusasion"

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:09; SBBY 203; Jin 452; Huang i4; Fu 95; tr. Hawkes 157;

tls:text.tls:line: Why then should I not alter my high intent?

sense.def: one's high intent; one's aspirations; one's moral aspiration, one's highest ambition; one's main tendencyBUDDH: religious aspirations

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:10; SBBY 204; Jin 452; Huang i4; Fu 95; tr. Hawkes 158;

tls:text.tls:line: How can I make companions of such as these?

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:10; SBBY 204; Jin 452; Huang i4; Fu 95; tr. Hawkes 158;

tls:text.tls:line: How can I make companions of such as these?

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:11; SBBY 205; Jin 452; Huang i4; Fu 96; tr. Hawkes 158;

tls:text.tls:line: 65 I once heard it said that he wo acts loyally wins hatred for his pains,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:11; SBBY 205; Jin 452; Huang i4; Fu 96; tr. Hawkes 158;

tls:text.tls:line: But 'he who has nine times broken his arm may set up as a physician';

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:11; SBBY 205; Jin 452; Huang i4; Fu 96; tr. Hawkes 158;

tls:text.tls:line: And now at last I know that what I was told is true.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:11; SBBY 205; Jin 452; Huang i4; Fu 96; tr. Hawkes 158;

tls:text.tls:line: And now at last I know that what I was told is true.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:11; SBBY 205; Jin 452; Huang i4; Fu 96; tr. Hawkes 158;

tls:text.tls:line: The crossbow was set and waiting overhead,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:11; SBBY 205; Jin 452; Huang i4; Fu 96; tr. Hawkes 158;

tls:text.tls:line: And all was set, and the traps laid out to gratify my lord,

sense.def: cause to be happily gratified> enchant; gratify, give satisfaction to, cause to be delighted

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:11; SBBY 205; Jin 452; Huang i4; Fu 96; tr. Hawkes 158;

tls:text.tls:line: So that even if I wished to escape, there was no way to turn.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:12; SBBY 206; Jin 458; Huang i4; Fu 96; tr. Hawkes 158;

tls:text.tls:line: I feared that a heavier fate might fall and he find more faults in me.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:12; SBBY 206; Jin 458; Huang i4; Fu 96; tr. Hawkes 158;

tls:text.tls:line: I feared that a heavier fate might fall and he find more faults in me.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:12; SBBY 206; Jin 458; Huang i4; Fu 96; tr. Hawkes 158;

tls:text.tls:line: If I thought to fly up high and settle far off elsewhere,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:12; SBBY 206; Jin 458; Huang i4; Fu 96; tr. Hawkes 158;

tls:text.tls:line: I might seek to pursue a crooked path and leave the straight road behind,

sense.def: travel route; lines of retreat or movement; line of communication to move through

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:12; SBBY 206; Jin 458; Huang i4; Fu 96; tr. Hawkes 158;

tls:text.tls:line: But my will was too strong and would not allow me to.

sense.def: be able to bear to V

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:12; SBBY 206; Jin 458; Huang i4; Fu 96; tr. Hawkes 158;

tls:text.tls:line: My back and my breast are split like a tally and my heart, torn between them, aches,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:12; SBBY 206; Jin 458; Huang i4; Fu 96; tr. Hawkes 158;

tls:text.tls:line: My back and my breast are split like a tally and my heart, torn between them, aches,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:13; SBBY 207; Jin 459; Huang 85; Fu 96; tr. Hawkes 158;

tls:text.tls:line: And because I fear that my true intent will not be believed,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:13; SBBY 207; Jin 459; Huang 85; Fu 96; tr. Hawkes 158;

tls:text.tls:line: And because I fear that my true intent will not be believed,

sense.def: the very substance of one's real feelings

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:13; SBBY 207; Jin 459; Huang 85; Fu 96; tr. Hawkes 158;

tls:text.tls:line: I have rehearsed all here to make myself understood.

sense.def: explain (onself), make (oneself) clear, make one's position clear

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:13; SBBY 207; Jin 459; Huang 85; Fu 96; tr. Hawkes 158;

tls:text.tls:line: I wish only to speed away and remove myself far off,

sense.def: private and secluded 私處; unauthorised

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 01:13; SBBY 207; Jin 459; Huang 85; Fu 96; tr. Hawkes 158;

tls:text.tls:line: To cherish these my delights in a private place.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 02:01; SBBY 208; Jin 466; Huang 87; Fu 99; tr. Hawkes 159;

tls:text.tls:line: 1 When I was young I loved this rare apparel;

sense.def: I (particularly from Warring States onwards: "I personally" rarely physically: "I purely physically (was injured etc) )

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 02:01; SBBY 208; Jin 466; Huang 87; Fu 99; tr. Hawkes 159;

tls:text.tls:line: 5 Round my neck moon-bright jewels, and a precious jade at my girdle.

sense.def: read pī: wear (cloth); bear (shield etc); abstractly, occasionally: bear (a bad name etc)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 02:01; SBBY 208; Jin 466; Huang 87; Fu 99; tr. Hawkes 159;

tls:text.tls:line: 5 Round my neck moon-bright jewels, and a precious jade at my girdle.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 02:02; SBBY 209; Jin 467; Huang 87; Fu 99; tr. Hawkes 160;

tls:text.tls:line: But the world was muddy-witted and could not understand me,

sense.def: murky and dirty (CC); be less than spotless

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 02:02; SBBY 209; Jin 467; Huang 87; Fu 99; tr. Hawkes 160;

tls:text.tls:line: But the world was muddy-witted and could not understand me,

sense.def: be (musically or morally) impure or defiled; be (metaphysically) muddied (i.e. soiled by contact with the world)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 02:02; SBBY 209; Jin 467; Huang 87; Fu 99; tr. Hawkes 160;

tls:text.tls:line: But the world was muddy-witted and could not understand me,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 02:02; SBBY 209; Jin 467; Huang 87; Fu 99; tr. Hawkes 160;

tls:text.tls:line: 10 Climbed mount Kūn-lún and ate of the flower of jade,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 02:02; SBBY 209; Jin 467; Huang 87; Fu 99; tr. Hawkes 160;

tls:text.tls:line: 10 Climbed mount Kūn-lún and ate of the flower of jade,

sense.def: blossom; especially: petals 美若英，落英

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 02:03; SBBY 210; Jin 467; Huang 87; Fu 99; tr. Hawkes 160;

tls:text.tls:line: 13 I was sad that the southern tribesmen could not undestand me,

sense.def: preposed object [relevant object cases must be moved here]

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 02:03; SBBY 210; Jin 467; Huang 87; Fu 99; tr. Hawkes 160;

tls:text.tls:line: 15 Climbing the height at Èzhǔ I looked back:

sense.def: ascend, try to gain the high ground or a wall; scale; board (a boat)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 02:03; SBBY 210; Jin 467; Huang 87; Fu 99; tr. Hawkes 160;

tls:text.tls:line: I walked my horses along the mountain side;

sense.def: cause to walk, make pace along (a horse etc)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 02:03; SBBY 210; Jin 467; Huang 87; Fu 99; tr. Hawkes 160;

tls:text.tls:line: Then, boarding a barge, I sailed up the River Yuán.

sense.def: CC: river-going small boat (with windows and roof)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 02:03; SBBY 210; Jin 467; Huang 87; Fu 99; tr. Hawkes 160;

tls:text.tls:line: Then, boarding a barge, I sailed up the River Yuán.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 02:03; SBBY 210; Jin 467; Huang 87; Fu 99; tr. Hawkes 160;

tls:text.tls:line: Then, boarding a barge, I sailed up the River Yuán.

sense.def: I (particularly from Warring States onwards: "I personally" rarely physically: "I purely physically (was injured etc) )

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 02:03; SBBY 210; Jin 467; Huang 87; Fu 99; tr. Hawkes 160;

tls:text.tls:line: 20 The oars of Wú dipped in time and beat the billowing water.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 02:04; SBBY 211; Jin 471; Huang 88; Fu 99; tr. Hawkes 160;

tls:text.tls:line: The boat went slowly, making little headway:

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 02:04; SBBY 211; Jin 471; Huang 88; Fu 99; tr. Hawkes 160;

tls:text.tls:line: 25 - If only my heart is straight and true,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 02:05; SBBY 212; Jin 476; Huang 88; Fu 99; tr. Hawkes 160;

tls:text.tls:line: When we entered Xù-pú, I halted uncertainly,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 02:05; SBBY 212; Jin 476; Huang 88; Fu 99; tr. Hawkes 160;

tls:text.tls:line: When we entered Xù-pú, I halted uncertainly,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 02:05; SBBY 212; Jin 476; Huang 88; Fu 99; tr. Hawkes 160;

tls:text.tls:line: Too distraught to think where I was going.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 02:05; SBBY 212; Jin 476; Huang 88; Fu 99; tr. Hawkes 160;

tls:text.tls:line: Amid the deep woods there, in the twilight gloom,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 02:05; SBBY 212; Jin 476; Huang 88; Fu 99; tr. Hawkes 160;

tls:text.tls:line: 30 Are the haunts where monkeys live.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 02:05; SBBY 212; Jin 476; Huang 88; Fu 99; tr. Hawkes 160;

tls:text.tls:line: 30 Are the haunts where monkeys live.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 02:05; SBBY 212; Jin 476; Huang 88; Fu 99; tr. Hawkes 160;

tls:text.tls:line: And below it is dark and dim with perpetual r ain;

sense.def: be dark and shady, be secluded

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 02:05; SBBY 212; Jin 476; Huang 88; Fu 99; tr. Hawkes 160;

tls:text.tls:line: And below it is dark and dim with perpetual r ain;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 02:05; SBBY 212; Jin 476; Huang 88; Fu 99; tr. Hawkes 160;

tls:text.tls:line: Sleet and snow fall there unendingly,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 02:05; SBBY 212; Jin 476; Huang 88; Fu 99; tr. Hawkes 160;

tls:text.tls:line: Sleet and snow fall there unendingly,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 02:05; SBBY 212; Jin 476; Huang 88; Fu 99; tr. Hawkes 160;

tls:text.tls:line: And the heavy clouds begin where the rooftops end.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 02:06; SBBY 212; Jin 476; Huang 88; Fu 99; tr. Hawkes 161;

tls:text.tls:line: That I should live here, alone and obscure, among the mountains!

sense.def: in hiding, hidden away, all hidden away; in hidden confinement 幽死

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 02:07; SBBY 213; Jin 479; Huang 88; Fu 99; tr. Hawkes 161;

tls:text.tls:line: Jiē Yú shaved his head;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 02:07; SBBY 213; Jin 479; Huang 88; Fu 99; tr. Hawkes 161;

tls:text.tls:line: 40 Sāng Hù naked ran;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 02:07; SBBY 213; Jin 479; Huang 88; Fu 99; tr. Hawkes 161;

tls:text.tls:line: Wǔ Zǐ-xu(?) met a bad end;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 02:07; SBBY 213; Jin 479; Huang 88; Fu 99; tr. Hawkes 161;

tls:text.tls:line: Bǐ Gān was cut and made into pickles.

sense.def: be cut up into pieces; be make into minced meat (sauce) by being cut up

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 02:07; SBBY 213; Jin 479; Huang 88; Fu 99; tr. Hawkes 161;

tls:text.tls:line: Bǐ Gān was cut and made into pickles.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 02:08; SBBY 214; Jin 479; Huang 88; Fu 99; tr. Hawkes 161;

tls:text.tls:line: Why should I complain of the men of today?

sense.def: why go on to? (expected answer: there is no reason to go on to...)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 02:09; SBBY 214; Jin 4i2; Huang 89; Fu 100; tr. Hawkes 161;

tls:text.tls:line: The phoenix and the phoenix's mate are daily more and more remote,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 02:09; SBBY 214; Jin 4i2; Huang 89; Fu 100; tr. Hawkes 161;

tls:text.tls:line: 50 And swallows, sparrows, crows and pies nest in the chambers and the high halls.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 02:09; SBBY 214; Jin 4i2; Huang 89; Fu 100; tr. Hawkes 161;

tls:text.tls:line: 50 And swallows, sparrows, crows and pies nest in the chambers and the high halls.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 02:09; SBBY 214; Jin 4i2; Huang 89; Fu 100; tr. Hawkes 161;

tls:text.tls:line: 50 And swallows, sparrows, crows and pies nest in the chambers and the high halls.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 02:09; SBBY 214; Jin 4i2; Huang 89; Fu 100; tr. Hawkes 161;

tls:text.tls:line: 50 And swallows, sparrows, crows and pies nest in the chambers and the high halls.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 03:01; SBBY 215; Jin 487; Huang 91; Fu 102; tr. Hawkes 164;

tls:text.tls:line: 1 High Heaven is not constant in its dispensations:

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 03:01; SBBY 215; Jin 487; Huang 91; Fu 102; tr. Hawkes 164;

tls:text.tls:line: See how the country is moved to unrest and error!

sense.def: the people who count; the gentry (i.e. primarily the wellborn people)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 03:01; SBBY 215; Jin 487; Huang 91; Fu 102; tr. Hawkes 164;

tls:text.tls:line: And following the waters of the Jiāng and the Xià, I travelled into exile.

sense.def: follow (the bank of a river); follow along; follow the course of; pass through in following one's course

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 03:02; SBBY 216; Jin 489; Huang 91; Fu 102; tr. Hawkes 164;

tls:text.tls:line: 9 As I set out from Yǐng and left my old ward in the city,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 03:02; SBBY 216; Jin 489; Huang 91; Fu 102; tr. Hawkes 164;

tls:text.tls:line: 'Oh my Yǐng, I shall never look on you again!'

sense.def: a second time; for the second time 再取 "marry again" 再。。。再 "over and over again..."

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 03:02; SBBY 216; Jin 489; Huang 91; Fu 102; tr. Hawkes 164;

tls:text.tls:line: I gazed on the high catalpa trees and heaved a heavy sigh,

sense.def: sigh (as a sign of hightened emotion)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 03:02; SBBY 216; Jin 489; Huang 91; Fu 102; tr. Hawkes 164;

tls:text.tls:line: And the tears in torrents, like winter's sleet, came down.

sense.def: tears (perhaps with an admixture of snivel)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 03:03; SBBY 217; Jin 490; Huang 91; Fu 102; tr. Hawkes 164;

tls:text.tls:line: As we rode on the Wave God's surging swell,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 03:03; SBBY 217; Jin 490; Huang 91; Fu 102; tr. Hawkes 164;

tls:text.tls:line: My heart was caught in a mesh that I could not disentangle;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 03:03; SBBY 217; Jin 490; Huang 91; Fu 102; tr. Hawkes 164;

tls:text.tls:line: My heart was caught in a mesh that I could not disentangle;

sense.def: tie up; bundle together; (bind together > solidify)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 03:04; SBBY 218; Jin 495; Huang 91; Fu 102; tr. Hawkes 164;

tls:text.tls:line: And now, at random drifting, I travelled towards the east.

sense.def: be at ease; saunter; be carefree; roam; enjoy oneself; have a good time

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 03:04; SBBY 218; Jin 495; Huang 91; Fu 102; tr. Hawkes 164;

tls:text.tls:line: But my soul within me longed to be returning:

sense.def: endowed with supernatural efficacy; endowed with supernatural dignity

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 03:04; SBBY 218; Jin 495; Huang 91; Fu 102; tr. Hawkes 164;

tls:text.tls:line: But my soul within me longed to be returning:

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 03:04; SBBY 218; Jin 495; Huang 91; Fu 102; tr. Hawkes 164;

tls:text.tls:line: Ah! when for one moment of the day have I not longed to go back?

sense.def: for a very short time, for as much as a moment; occasionally used nominally: a moment of life; after a very short time, in no time

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 03:04; SBBY 218; Jin 495; Huang 91; Fu 102; tr. Hawkes 164;

tls:text.tls:line: And I grieved that the Old City grew daily farther from me.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 03:04; SBBY 218; Jin 495; Huang 91; Fu 102; tr. Hawkes 164;

tls:text.tls:line: And I grieved that the Old City grew daily farther from me.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 03:04; SBBY 218; Jin 495; Huang 91; Fu 102; tr. Hawkes 164;

tls:text.tls:line: And I grieved that the Old City grew daily farther from me.

sense.def: daily, every day; day in and day out; progressively generally: all the time

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 03:05; SBBY 219; Jin 495; Huang 92; Fu 102; tr. Hawkes 165;

tls:text.tls:line: 33 I climbed a steep islet's height and looked into the distance,

sense.def: climb up, go up; also by flying: 豋天 "rise to Heaven".

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 03:05; SBBY 219; Jin 495; Huang 92; Fu 102; tr. Hawkes 165;

tls:text.tls:line: 33 I climbed a steep islet's height and looked into the distance,

sense.def: tumulus tomb, typically planted with trees

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 03:05; SBBY 219; Jin 495; Huang 92; Fu 102; tr. Hawkes 165;

tls:text.tls:line: Thinking to ease the sorrow in my heart:

sense.def: dredge out and explain; give full expression to.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 03:05; SBBY 219; Jin 495; Huang 92; Fu 102; tr. Hawkes 165;

tls:text.tls:line: But only grief came for the rich, blest River Kingdom,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 03:05; SBBY 219; Jin 495; Huang 92; Fu 102; tr. Hawkes 165;

tls:text.tls:line: Or cross south over the vatery waste to reach it.

sense.def: cross river by boat or ferry; derived general sense: to cross (also by foot at a ford)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 03:05; SBBY 219; Jin 495; Huang 92; Fu 102; tr. Hawkes 165;

tls:text.tls:line: To think that its palace walls should be mounds of rubble,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 03:05; SBBY 219; Jin 495; Huang 92; Fu 102; tr. Hawkes 165;

tls:text.tls:line: To think that its palace walls should be mounds of rubble,

sense.def: never 曾不知 "I never knew, they never understood"

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 03:05; SBBY 219; Jin 495; Huang 92; Fu 102; tr. Hawkes 165;

tls:text.tls:line: To think that its palace walls should be mounds of rubble,

sense.def: mounds of rubble, ruins 夏之為丘"that Xià is in ruins".

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 03:05; SBBY 219; Jin 495; Huang 92; Fu 102; tr. Hawkes 165;

tls:text.tls:line: And its two East Gates a wilderness of weeds!

sense.def: the pair of, the two, both 兩手，兩目，兩耳

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 03:06; SBBY 220; Jin 499; Huang 92; Fu 103; tr. Hawkes 165;

tls:text.tls:line: 41 It is now a long time since my heart has known happiness;

sense.def: be pleased; be happy (不怡 "be displeased; be in a bad mood; be dissatisfied")

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 03:06; SBBY 220; Jin 499; Huang 92; Fu 103; tr. Hawkes 165;

tls:text.tls:line: I think how long and hard the road to Yǐng is,

sense.def: travel route; lines of retreat or movement; line of communication to move through

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 03:06; SBBY 220; Jin 499; Huang 92; Fu 103; tr. Hawkes 165;

tls:text.tls:line: I think how long and hard the road to Yǐng is,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 03:06; SBBY 220; Jin 499; Huang 92; Fu 103; tr. Hawkes 165;

tls:text.tls:line: I think how long and hard the road to Yǐng is,

sense.def: be distant; be far away, be far off; be a long way; go a long way

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 03:06; SBBY 220; Jin 499; Huang 92; Fu 103; tr. Hawkes 165;

tls:text.tls:line: I am tied to one spot and my mouth is full of gall.

sense.def: hence: harbour inside one (any kinds of feelings or sentiments) [See also CONTAIN][CA]

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 03:07; SBBY 221; Jin 503; Huang 92; Fu 103; tr. Hawkes 165;

tls:text.tls:line: Jealousy cut me off and blocked my way to you.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 03:08; SBBY 221; Jin 503; Huang 92; Fu 103; tr. Hawkes 165;

tls:text.tls:line: 53 Though Yáo and Shùn exelled in noble actions,

sense.def: resilient (behaviour), nobly independent; showing noble resilience

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 03:08; SBBY 221; Jin 503; Huang 92; Fu 103; tr. Hawkes 165;

tls:text.tls:line: The crowd of backbiters were envious of their fame

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 03:08; SBBY 221; Jin 503; Huang 92; Fu 103; tr. Hawkes 165;

tls:text.tls:line: And gave them a false name, saying they were not kind.

sense.def: artificial; pretended; fake, faked; pretending; faking

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 03:09; SBBY 221; Jin 503; Huang 92; Fu 103; tr. Hawkes 165;

tls:text.tls:line: 57 You hate the deep and studious search for beauty,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 03:09; SBBY 221; Jin 503; Huang 92; Fu 103; tr. Hawkes 165;

tls:text.tls:line: And so the crowd press forward and each day advance in your favours,

sense.def: go to and fro; press forward

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 03:09; SBBY 221; Jin 503; Huang 92; Fu 103; tr. Hawkes 165;

tls:text.tls:line: And so the crowd press forward and each day advance in your favours,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 03:10; SBBY 222; Jin 506; Huang 93; Fu 103; tr. Hawkes 166;

tls:text.tls:line: 61 Long my eyes rove, upon the distance gazing.

sense.def: look at and enjoy things, look around; behold 觀者"beholder"

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 03:10; SBBY 222; Jin 506; Huang 93; Fu 103; tr. Hawkes 166;

tls:text.tls:line: I long but once to return; but when will that time be?

sense.def: once, one time (versus 再 "twice"); at any time; also: 壹陰兮壹陽

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:01; SBBY 223; Jin 508; Huang 94; Fu 105; tr. Hawkes 166;

tls:text.tls:line: Long and alone I sigh, but the pain grows only greater.

sense.def: for a fairly long time; all the time CC 永歎; forever

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:03; SBBY 223; Jin 508; Huang 95; Fu 105; tr. Hawkes 167;

tls:text.tls:line: But seeing how others have fared, I restrain myself,

sense.def: gaze down upon, look at from above, survey from above, look at appreciatingly from above; to survey from above, synoptically and without attention to detail, taking in a scene in a sweeping movement, at a distance.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:03; SBBY 223; Jin 508; Huang 95; Fu 105; tr. Hawkes 167;

tls:text.tls:line: But seeing how others have fared, I restrain myself,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:03; SBBY 223; Jin 508; Huang 95; Fu 105; tr. Hawkes 167;

tls:text.tls:line: But seeing how others have fared, I restrain myself,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:03; SBBY 223; Jin 508; Huang 95; Fu 105; tr. Hawkes 167;

tls:text.tls:line: And instead I have set out my secret thoughts and put them into verse,

sense.def: subtle, having a light touch, subtle and profound; BUDDH: of subtle significance for salvation

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:03; SBBY 223; Jin 508; Huang 95; Fu 105; tr. Hawkes 167;

tls:text.tls:line: And instead I have set out my secret thoughts and put them into verse,

sense.def: real inner state; innermost feelings; real inner feelings; basic feelings; basic loyalties; sentiment

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:03; SBBY 223; Jin 508; Huang 95; Fu 105; tr. Hawkes 167;

tls:text.tls:line: And instead I have set out my secret thoughts and put them into verse,

sense.def: express (a promise etc), put forward (a statement etc)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:04; SBBY 224; Jin 512; Huang 95; Fu 106; tr. Hawkes 167;

tls:text.tls:line: But when you had gone half-way, you turned back again,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:05; SBBY 224; Jin 512; Huang 95; Fu 106; tr. Hawkes 167;

tls:text.tls:line: 17 You vaunted your comeliness before me;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:05; SBBY 224; Jin 512; Huang 95; Fu 106; tr. Hawkes 167;

tls:text.tls:line: 17 You vaunted your comeliness before me;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:05; SBBY 224; Jin 512; Huang 95; Fu 106; tr. Hawkes 167;

tls:text.tls:line: 17 You vaunted your comeliness before me;

sense.def: the state of being beautiful; beauty

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:05; SBBY 224; Jin 512; Huang 95; Fu 106; tr. Hawkes 167;

tls:text.tls:line: You showed me all your fine array;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:05; SBBY 224; Jin 512; Huang 95; Fu 106; tr. Hawkes 167;

tls:text.tls:line: You showed me all your fine array;

sense.def: fair, refined, cultivared, CC 修德 "refined, fair virtue"

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:05; SBBY 224; Jin 512; Huang 95; Fu 106; tr. Hawkes 167;

tls:text.tls:line: You showed me all your fine array;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:05; SBBY 224; Jin 512; Huang 95; Fu 106; tr. Hawkes 167;

tls:text.tls:line: Why then should you went your anger on me?

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:06; SBBY 225; Jin 512; Huang 95; Fu 106; tr. Hawkes 167;

tls:text.tls:line: 21 I wanted to wait on this leisure and explain myself to him,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:07; SBBY 225; Jin 512; Huang 95; Fu 106; tr. Hawkes 167;

tls:text.tls:line: 25 And when I unlocked these thoughts of mine and put them into words,

sense.def: real inner state; innermost feelings; real inner feelings; basic feelings; basic loyalties; sentiment

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:07; SBBY 225; Jin 512; Huang 95; Fu 106; tr. Hawkes 167;

tls:text.tls:line: 25 And when I unlocked these thoughts of mine and put them into words,

sense.def: express (a promise etc), put forward (a statement etc)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:07; SBBY 225; Jin 512; Huang 95; Fu 106; tr. Hawkes 167;

tls:text.tls:line: 25 And when I unlocked these thoughts of mine and put them into words,

sense.def: speech; formal submission, also in written form

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:08; SBBY 225; Jin 516; Huang 95; Fu 106; tr. Hawkes 167;

tls:text.tls:line: 29 That which I first set forth is there to see, plain and clear:

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:08; SBBY 225; Jin 516; Huang 95; Fu 106; tr. Hawkes 167;

tls:text.tls:line: How can it be that today you suddenly cannot remember?

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:10; SBBY 226; Jin 516; Huang 96; Fu 106; tr. Hawkes 168;

tls:text.tls:line: Who without fruits ever reaped a harvest fair?

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:10; SBBY 226; Jin 516; Huang 96; Fu 106; tr. Hawkes 168;

tls:text.tls:line: Who without fruits ever reaped a harvest fair?

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:11; SBBY 226; Jin 520; Huang 96; Fu 106; tr. Hawkes 168;

tls:text.tls:line: Shao Ge

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:11; SBBY 226; Jin 520; Huang 96; Fu 106; tr. Hawkes 168;

tls:text.tls:line: 41 I unlocked my thoughts to set before the Fair One,

sense.def: exhibit (what is basically hidden) for others to see

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:11; SBBY 226; Jin 520; Huang 96; Fu 106; tr. Hawkes 168;

tls:text.tls:line: He vaunted his comeliness before me,

sense.def: beauty and excellence, points of excellence

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:11; SBBY 226; Jin 520; Huang 96; Fu 106; tr. Hawkes 168;

tls:text.tls:line: Disdained my words, and would not hear them.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:12; SBBY 227; Jin 520; Huang 96; Fu 106; tr. Hawkes 168;

tls:text.tls:line: Come to settle north of the Hàn;

sense.def: to come in order to V; come so as to V; come for the purpose of Ving

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:12; SBBY 227; Jin 520; Huang 96; Fu 106; tr. Hawkes 168;

tls:text.tls:line: Come to settle north of the Hàn;

sense.def: perch on; sit on, settle on; settle in (a place)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:12; SBBY 227; Jin 520; Huang 96; Fu 106; tr. Hawkes 168;

tls:text.tls:line: Most fair and rare and beautiful,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:12; SBBY 227; Jin 520; Huang 96; Fu 106; tr. Hawkes 168;

tls:text.tls:line: Most fair and rare and beautiful,

sense.def: be beautiful to look at, be attractive 甚好LIEXIANZHUAN 姿貌好而性良

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:12; SBBY 227; Jin 520; Huang 96; Fu 106; tr. Hawkes 168;

tls:text.tls:line: Most fair and rare and beautiful,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:12; SBBY 227; Jin 520; Huang 96; Fu 106; tr. Hawkes 168;

tls:text.tls:line: Most fair and rare and beautiful,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:12; SBBY 227; Jin 520; Huang 96; Fu 106; tr. Hawkes 168;

tls:text.tls:line: Most fair and rare and beautiful,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:12; SBBY 227; Jin 520; Huang 96; Fu 106; tr. Hawkes 168;

tls:text.tls:line: Most fair and rare and beautiful,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:12; SBBY 227; Jin 520; Huang 96; Fu 106; tr. Hawkes 168;

tls:text.tls:line: Most fair and rare and beautiful,

sense.def: be decorative, evenly patterned, beautifully patterned, symmetrically patterned; elegant and beautiful; be magnificent, be imposing (as the sound of a drum)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:12; SBBY 227; Jin 520; Huang 96; Fu 106; tr. Hawkes 168;

tls:text.tls:line: With no one by to find him a mate.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:13; SBBY 227; Jin 520; Huang 96; Fu 106; tr. Hawkes 168;

tls:text.tls:line: And I wish to make my plaint, but I cannot, for none will hear.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:13; SBBY 227; Jin 520; Huang 96; Fu 106; tr. Hawkes 168;

tls:text.tls:line: I gaze on the northern hills and my tears come falling,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:13; SBBY 227; Jin 520; Huang 96; Fu 106; tr. Hawkes 168;

tls:text.tls:line: I gaze on the northern hills and my tears come falling,

sense.def: tears (perhaps with an admixture of snivel)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:13; SBBY 227; Jin 520; Huang 96; Fu 106; tr. Hawkes 168;

tls:text.tls:line: Look down on the flowing waters and heave a dolorous sigh.

sense.def: sigh (as a sign of hightened emotion)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:14; SBBY 228; Jin 520; Huang 96; Fu 106; tr. Hawkes 168;

tls:text.tls:line: Though the road to Yǐng is a far, far distant journey,

sense.def: travel route; lines of retreat or movement; line of communication to move through

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:14; SBBY 228; Jin 520; Huang 96; Fu 106; tr. Hawkes 168;

tls:text.tls:line: Though the road to Yǐng is a far, far distant journey,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:15; SBBY 228; Jin 520; Huang 97; Fu 106; tr. Hawkes 168;

tls:text.tls:line: And because it does not know the twist and turns of the way there,

sense.def: never 曾不知 "I never knew, they never understood"

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:15; SBBY 228; Jin 520; Huang 97; Fu 106; tr. Hawkes 168;

tls:text.tls:line: And because it does not know the twist and turns of the way there,

sense.def: wide road suitable for carts (as means of communication)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:16; SBBY 228; Jin 520; Huang 97; Fu 106; tr. Hawkes 169;

tls:text.tls:line: 63 Why should my soul be so true and constant?

sense.def: endowed with supernatural efficacy; endowed with supernatural dignity

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:17; SBBY 229; Jin 528; Huang 97; Fu 106; tr. Hawkes 169;

tls:text.tls:line: 67 In the long shallows the current races, flowing to meet the deeps of the river;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:17; SBBY 229; Jin 528; Huang 97; Fu 106; tr. Hawkes 169;

tls:text.tls:line: 67 In the long shallows the current races, flowing to meet the deeps of the river;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:17; SBBY 229; Jin 528; Huang 97; Fu 106; tr. Hawkes 169;

tls:text.tls:line: There, with wild glances, I wander southwards, thinking to ease my heart a little.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:17; SBBY 229; Jin 528; Huang 97; Fu 106; tr. Hawkes 169;

tls:text.tls:line: There, with wild glances, I wander southwards, thinking to ease my heart a little.

sense.def: cause to be happily gratified> enchant; gratify, give satisfaction to, cause to be delighted

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:17; SBBY 229; Jin 528; Huang 97; Fu 106; tr. Hawkes 169;

tls:text.tls:line: The sad sighs rack my soul; my spirit far is yearning.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:17; SBBY 229; Jin 528; Huang 97; Fu 106; tr. Hawkes 169;

tls:text.tls:line: The sad sighs rack my soul; my spirit far is yearning.

sense.def: into the far distance; from a far distance; in the far distance; into the distance

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:17; SBBY 229; Jin 528; Huang 97; Fu 106; tr. Hawkes 169;

tls:text.tls:line: Distant the road, obscure the place, and no one to rack my suit to!

sense.def: travel route; lines of retreat or movement; line of communication to move through

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:17; SBBY 229; Jin 528; Huang 97; Fu 106; tr. Hawkes 169;

tls:text.tls:line: Distant the road, obscure the place, and no one to rack my suit to!

sense.def: be dark and shady, be secluded

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:18; SBBY 230; Jin 528; Huang 97; Fu 107; tr. Hawkes 169;

tls:text.tls:line: 75 I tell thoughts in my song, thinking to ease my sorrow;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:18; SBBY 230; Jin 528; Huang 97; Fu 107; tr. Hawkes 169;

tls:text.tls:line: But my melancholy finds no course; to whom can these words be uttered?

sense.def: this (modifying non-concrete objects) 斯文, 斯道

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 04:18; SBBY 230; Jin 528; Huang 97; Fu 107; tr. Hawkes 169;

tls:text.tls:line: But my melancholy finds no course; to whom can these words be uttered?

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 05:01; SBBY 230; Jin 535; Huang 99; Fu 109; tr. Hawkes 170;

tls:text.tls:line: When flowers and trees burgeon,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 05:02; SBBY 231; Jin 535; Huang 99; Fu 109; tr. Hawkes 170;

tls:text.tls:line: Where a great quiet and stillness reign.

sense.def: be dark and shady, be secluded

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 05:03; SBBY 231; Jin 535; Huang 100; Fu 109; tr. Hawkes 170;

tls:text.tls:line: 9 I soothed my feelings, sought my purposes,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 05:03; SBBY 231; Jin 535; Huang 100; Fu 109; tr. Hawkes 170;

tls:text.tls:line: 9 I soothed my feelings, sought my purposes,

sense.def: real inner state; innermost feelings; real inner feelings; basic feelings; basic loyalties; sentiment

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 05:03; SBBY 231; Jin 535; Huang 100; Fu 109; tr. Hawkes 170;

tls:text.tls:line: Bowed to my wrongs and still restrained myself.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 05:04; SBBY 231; Jin 538; Huang 100; Fu 109; tr. Hawkes 170;

tls:text.tls:line: My former path I did not change.

sense.def: change; change and improve; change and bring under control

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 05:05; SBBY 232; Jin 538; Huang 100; Fu 109; tr. Hawkes 170;

tls:text.tls:line: In this the great man exels so richly.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 05:06; SBBY 232; Jin 538; Huang 100; Fu 110; tr. Hawkes 171;

tls:text.tls:line: 21 When dark brocade is placed in the dark,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 05:06; SBBY 232; Jin 538; Huang 100; Fu 110; tr. Hawkes 171;

tls:text.tls:line: The dim-eyed will say it has no pattern.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 05:06; SBBY 232; Jin 538; Huang 100; Fu 110; tr. Hawkes 171;

tls:text.tls:line: The dim-eyed will say it has no pattern.

sense.def: those who have bad eyesight, the blind

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 05:06; SBBY 232; Jin 538; Huang 100; Fu 110; tr. Hawkes 171;

tls:text.tls:line: The dim-eyed will say it has no pattern.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 05:06; SBBY 232; Jin 538; Huang 100; Fu 110; tr. Hawkes 171;

tls:text.tls:line: The purblind think that he must be sightless.

sense.def: the blind (often regarded as distinguished for their ability as musicians)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 05:07; SBBY 233; Jin 538; Huang 100; Fu 110; tr. Hawkes 171;

tls:text.tls:line: 25 White is changed to black;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 05:07; SBBY 233; Jin 538; Huang 100; Fu 110; tr. Hawkes 171;

tls:text.tls:line: 25 White is changed to black;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 05:07; SBBY 233; Jin 538; Huang 100; Fu 110; tr. Hawkes 171;

tls:text.tls:line: The phoenix languishes in a cage,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 05:07; SBBY 233; Jin 538; Huang 100; Fu 110; tr. Hawkes 171;

tls:text.tls:line: While hens and ducks can gambol free.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 05:07; SBBY 233; Jin 538; Huang 100; Fu 110; tr. Hawkes 171;

tls:text.tls:line: While hens and ducks can gambol free.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 05:07; SBBY 233; Jin 538; Huang 100; Fu 110; tr. Hawkes 171;

tls:text.tls:line: While hens and ducks can gambol free.

sense.def: fly to and fro, soar; hover

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUZHANG 05:08; SBBY 233; Jin 538; Huang 100; Fu 110; tr. Hawkes 171;

tls:text.tls:line: They cannot understand the things I prize.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
