tls:text.tls:line: 167 In the sheer depths below, the earth was invisible;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC YUANYOU 01:28; SBBY 287; Jin 731; Huang 129; Fu 131; tr. Hawkes 199;

tls:text.tls:line: 167 In the sheer depths below, the earth was invisible;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC YUANYOU 01:28; SBBY 287; Jin 731; Huang 129; Fu 131; tr. Hawkes 199;

tls:text.tls:line: In the vastness above, the sky could not be seen.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC YUANYOU 01:28; SBBY 287; Jin 731; Huang 129; Fu 131; tr. Hawkes 199;

tls:text.tls:line: In the vastness above, the sky could not be seen.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC YUANYOU 01:28; SBBY 287; Jin 731; Huang 129; Fu 131; tr. Hawkes 199;

tls:text.tls:line: Transcending Inaction, I came to Purity,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC BUJU 01:03; SBBY 290; Jin 744; Huang 133; Fu 137; tr. Hawkes 204;

tls:text.tls:line: 'Is it better,' Qū Yuán asked him, to be painstakingly honest,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC BUJU 01:04; SBBY 291; Jin 744; Huang 134; Fu 137; tr. Hawkes 204;

tls:text.tls:line: by speaking truthfully and without concealment,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC BUJU 01:04; SBBY 291; Jin 744; Huang 134; Fu 137; tr. Hawkes 204;

tls:text.tls:line: by speaking truthfully and without concealment,

sense.def: contrastive: one's own person; oneself; himself

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC BUJU 01:04; SBBY 291; Jin 744; Huang 134; Fu 137; tr. Hawkes 204;

tls:text.tls:line: by means of a lofty detatchment,

sense.def: inner integrity; what is genuine in one; genuine inner nature; genuine essence; one's true being

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC BUJU 01:04; SBBY 291; Jin 744; Huang 134; Fu 137; tr. Hawkes 204;

tls:text.tls:line: or to wait on a king's mistress with

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC BUJU 01:04; SBBY 291; Jin 744; Huang 134; Fu 137; tr. Hawkes 204;

tls:text.tls:line: flattery, fawning,

sense.def: to chuckle; cry; sound of a crow

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC BUJU 01:04; SBBY 291; Jin 744; Huang 134; Fu 137; tr. Hawkes 204;

tls:text.tls:line: flattery, fawning,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC BUJU 01:05; SBBY 292; Jin 744; Huang 134; Fu 137; tr. Hawkes 205;

tls:text.tls:line: Is it better to be honest and incorruptible

sense.def: be impeccable; HF 6.3.31: be morally incorruptible, morally pure, morally scrupulous; honest

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC BUJU 01:05; SBBY 292; Jin 744; Huang 134; Fu 137; tr. Hawkes 205;

tls:text.tls:line: Is it better to be honest and incorruptible

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC BUJU 01:05; SBBY 292; Jin 744; Huang 134; Fu 137; tr. Hawkes 205;

tls:text.tls:line: and to keep oneself pure,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC BUJU 01:05; SBBY 292; Jin 744; Huang 134; Fu 137; tr. Hawkes 205;

tls:text.tls:line: or to be accomodating and slippery,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC BUJU 01:05; SBBY 292; Jin 744; Huang 134; Fu 137; tr. Hawkes 205;

tls:text.tls:line: or to drift this way and that like a duck on water,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC BUJU 01:05; SBBY 292; Jin 744; Huang 134; Fu 137; tr. Hawkes 205;

tls:text.tls:line: or to drift this way and that like a duck on water,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC BUJU 01:05; SBBY 292; Jin 744; Huang 134; Fu 137; tr. Hawkes 205;

tls:text.tls:line: or to drift this way and that like a duck on water,

sense.def: wild duck (much appreciated as a delicacy); 妗挀� "tame duck"????

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC BUJU 01:05; SBBY 292; Jin 744; Huang 134; Fu 137; tr. Hawkes 205;

tls:text.tls:line: by rising and falling with the waves?

sense.def: engage in secretive unreglemented action, engage in fraudulent underhand action

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC BUJU 01:06; SBBY 292; Jin 744; Huang 134; Fu 137; tr. Hawkes 205;

tls:text.tls:line: or to dispute for scraps with chicken and ducks?

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC BUJU 01:06; SBBY 292; Jin 744; Huang 134; Fu 137; tr. Hawkes 205;

tls:text.tls:line: 'Of these alterenatives, which is auspicious and which is ill-omened?

sense.def: be auspicious; be lucky; bode well

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC BUJU 01:06; SBBY 292; Jin 744; Huang 134; Fu 137; tr. Hawkes 205;

tls:text.tls:line: 'Of these alterenatives, which is auspicious and which is ill-omened?

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC BUJU 01:07; SBBY 293; Jin 744; Huang 134; Fu 137; tr. Hawkes 205;

tls:text.tls:line: The world is turbulent and impure;

sense.def: murky and dirty (CC); be less than spotless

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC BUJU 01:07; SBBY 293; Jin 744; Huang 134; Fu 137; tr. Hawkes 205;

tls:text.tls:line: The world is turbulent and impure;

sense.def: be (musically or morally) impure or defiled; be (metaphysically) muddied (i.e. soiled by contact with the world)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC BUJU 01:07; SBBY 293; Jin 744; Huang 134; Fu 137; tr. Hawkes 205;

tls:text.tls:line: who can know of my integrity?'

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC BUJU 01:08; SBBY 293; Jin 756; Huang 134; Fu 137; tr. Hawkes 205;

tls:text.tls:line: in which knowledge can give no enlightenment.

sense.def: intellect; intellectual competence, professional competence; intelligence, intellectual capacity

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC BUJU 01:08; SBBY 293; Jin 756; Huang 134; Fu 137; tr. Hawkes 205;

tls:text.tls:line: There are things to which my calculations cannot attain,

sense.def: reach up to, get to the level of; match

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC BUJU 01:08; SBBY 293; Jin 756; Huang 134; Fu 137; tr. Hawkes 205;

tls:text.tls:line: over which the divinity has no power.

sense.def: have thorough knowledge of, see to the bottom of, have a full understanding of

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC YUFU 01:01; SBBY 296; Jin 758; Huang 136; Fu 141; tr. Hawkes 206;

tls:text.tls:line: After Qū Yuán was banished, he wandered, sometimes along the river's banks,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC YUFU 01:01; SBBY 296; Jin 758; Huang 136; Fu 141; tr. Hawkes 206;

tls:text.tls:line: After Qū Yuán was banished, he wandered, sometimes along the river's banks,

sense.def: Southern speech: deep water, deep pool

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC YUFU 01:01; SBBY 296; Jin 758; Huang 136; Fu 141; tr. Hawkes 206;

tls:text.tls:line: sometimes along the marsh's edge, singing as he went.

sense.def: quietly chant poetry to oneself (as one goes); sing softly to oneself (as one goes)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC YUFU 01:01; SBBY 296; Jin 758; Huang 136; Fu 141; tr. Hawkes 206;

tls:text.tls:line: His expression was dejected

sense.def: facial expression, countenance; sometimes non-expressive: facial complexion 顏色黯黑 "my facial complexion is all dark".

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC YUFU 01:01; SBBY 296; Jin 758; Huang 136; Fu 141; tr. Hawkes 206;

tls:text.tls:line: and his features emaciated.

sense.def: physical outline and appearance, physical appearance

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC YUFU 01:01; SBBY 296; Jin 758; Huang 136; Fu 141; tr. Hawkes 206;

tls:text.tls:line: and his features emaciated.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC YUFU 01:02; SBBY 296; Jin 758; Huang 136; Fu 141; tr. Hawkes 206;

tls:text.tls:line: A fisherman caught sight of him.

sense.def: ask interlocutor N and say: 問師曠曰

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC YUFU 01:02; SBBY 296; Jin 758; Huang 136; Fu 141; tr. Hawkes 206;

tls:text.tls:line: 'What has brought you to his pass?'

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC YUFU 01:02; SBBY 296; Jin 758; Huang 136; Fu 141; tr. Hawkes 206;

tls:text.tls:line: 'What has brought you to his pass?'

sense.def: this abstract thing; this event; this course of action; this point

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC YUFU 01:02; SBBY 296; Jin 758; Huang 136; Fu 141; tr. Hawkes 206;

tls:text.tls:line: said Qū Yuán,

sense.def: whole, entire; all the 舉國

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC YUFU 01:02; SBBY 296; Jin 758; Huang 136; Fu 141; tr. Hawkes 206;

tls:text.tls:line: said Qū Yuán,

sense.def: be (musically or morally) impure or defiled; be (metaphysically) muddied (i.e. soiled by contact with the world)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC YUFU 01:02; SBBY 296; Jin 758; Huang 136; Fu 141; tr. Hawkes 206;

tls:text.tls:line: said Qū Yuán,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC YUFU 01:02; SBBY 296; Jin 758; Huang 136; Fu 141; tr. Hawkes 206;

tls:text.tls:line: I have been sent into exile.'

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC YUFU 01:02; SBBY 296; Jin 758; Huang 136; Fu 141; tr. Hawkes 206;

tls:text.tls:line: I have been sent into exile.'

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC YUFU 01:03; SBBY 296; Jin 758; Huang 136; Fu 141; tr. Hawkes 206;

tls:text.tls:line: said the fisherman,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC YUFU 01:03; SBBY 296; Jin 758; Huang 136; Fu 141; tr. Hawkes 206;

tls:text.tls:line: 'but can move as the world moves.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC YUFU 01:03; SBBY 296; Jin 758; Huang 136; Fu 141; tr. Hawkes 206;

tls:text.tls:line: If all the world is muddy,

sense.def: be (musically or morally) impure or defiled; be (metaphysically) muddied (i.e. soiled by contact with the world)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC YUFU 01:03; SBBY 296; Jin 758; Huang 136; Fu 141; tr. Hawkes 206;

tls:text.tls:line: And if all men are drunk,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC YUFU 01:03; SBBY 296; Jin 758; Huang 136; Fu 141; tr. Hawkes 206;

tls:text.tls:line: why not sup their dregs and swill their lees?

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC YUFU 01:03; SBBY 296; Jin 758; Huang 136; Fu 141; tr. Hawkes 206;

tls:text.tls:line: why not sup their dregs and swill their lees?

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC YUFU 01:03; SBBY 296; Jin 758; Huang 136; Fu 141; tr. Hawkes 206;

tls:text.tls:line: why not sup their dregs and swill their lees?

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC YUFU 01:03; SBBY 296; Jin 758; Huang 136; Fu 141; tr. Hawkes 206;

tls:text.tls:line: why not sup their dregs and swill their lees?

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC YUFU 01:03; SBBY 296; Jin 758; Huang 136; Fu 141; tr. Hawkes 206;

tls:text.tls:line: Why get yourself exiled

sense.def: why? (i.e. surely for no good subjective reason)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC YUFU 01:03; SBBY 296; Jin 758; Huang 136; Fu 141; tr. Hawkes 206;

tls:text.tls:line: because of your deep thoughts and your fine aspirations?'

sense.def: cause (oneself) to V [Note that this does not get the semantic category "caus".]

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC YUFU 01:03; SBBY 296; Jin 758; Huang 136; Fu 141; tr. Hawkes 206;

tls:text.tls:line: because of your deep thoughts and your fine aspirations?'

sense.def: how? (i.e. in no way); for what? to what purpose? (with or without additional 何)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC YUFU 01:04; SBBY 297; Jin 758; Huang 137; Fu 141; tr. Hawkes 206;

tls:text.tls:line: "He who has just washed his hair should brush his hat;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC YUFU 01:04; SBBY 297; Jin 758; Huang 137; Fu 141; tr. Hawkes 206;

tls:text.tls:line: and he who has just bathed should shake his clothes."

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC YUFU 01:04; SBBY 297; Jin 758; Huang 137; Fu 141; tr. Hawkes 206;

tls:text.tls:line: How can I submit my spotless purity

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC YUFU 01:04; SBBY 297; Jin 758; Huang 137; Fu 141; tr. Hawkes 206;

tls:text.tls:line: I would rather cast myself into the waters of the river

sense.def: dive into, throw oneself into; sink into

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC YUFU 01:04; SBBY 297; Jin 758; Huang 137; Fu 141; tr. Hawkes 206;

tls:text.tls:line: than hide my shining light

sense.def: how? (idiomatic in 安得 "how can one get to?", 安敢"how would I dare to?")

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC YUFU 01:04; SBBY 297; Jin 758; Huang 137; Fu 141; tr. Hawkes 206;

tls:text.tls:line: than hide my shining light

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC YUFU 01:05; SBBY 298; Jin 765; Huang 137; Fu 141; tr. Hawkes 207;

tls:text.tls:line: The fisherman, with a faint smile,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC YUFU 01:05; SBBY 298; Jin 765; Huang 137; Fu 141; tr. Hawkes 207;

tls:text.tls:line: The fisherman, with a faint smile,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC YUFU 01:05; SBBY 298; Jin 765; Huang 137; Fu 141; tr. Hawkes 207;

tls:text.tls:line: And as he went he sang:

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC YUFU 01:05; SBBY 298; Jin 765; Huang 137; Fu 141; tr. Hawkes 207;

tls:text.tls:line: When the Cāng-làng's waters are muddy,

sense.def: mixed with impurities and sediment; impure

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC YUFU 01:05; SBBY 298; Jin 765; Huang 137; Fu 141; tr. Hawkes 207;

tls:text.tls:line: I can wash my feet in them.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 01:01; SBBY 302; Huang 140; Fu 143; tr. Hawkes 209;

tls:text.tls:line: 1 Alas for the breath of autumn!

sense.def: be sad in quality; be sad to look at/think about; be pathetic

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 01:01; SBBY 302; Huang 140; Fu 143; tr. Hawkes 209;

tls:text.tls:line: 1 Alas for the breath of autumn!

sense.def: the way the air is, the nature of the vital energies of the world> weather

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 01:02; SBBY 303; Huang 140; Fu 143; tr. Hawkes 209;

tls:text.tls:line: leaving the old and to new places turning;

sense.def: what is new; the new ones; new stuff

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 01:03; SBBY 304; Huang 140; Fu 143; tr. Hawkes 209;

tls:text.tls:line: 10 Melancholy:

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 01:03; SBBY 304; Huang 140; Fu 143; tr. Hawkes 209;

tls:text.tls:line: he nurses a private sorrow.

sense.def: unofficially, in a non-official way; for one's own personal purposes; in a way not defined by one's public obligations; in an unlicenced way,unofficially, personally, in an unauthorised way; privately and not on an official public occasion

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 01:03; SBBY 304; Huang 140; Fu 143; tr. Hawkes 209;

tls:text.tls:line: 15 Alone he waits for the dawn to come, unsleeping,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 02:01; SBBY 305; Huang 141; Fu 144; tr. Hawkes 210;

tls:text.tls:line: 1 Sad and in sore straits I dwell alone.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 02:01; SBBY 305; Huang 141; Fu 144; tr. Hawkes 210;

tls:text.tls:line: Far have I wandered: where will my journeying end?

sense.def: be at ease; saunter; be carefree; roam; enjoy oneself; have a good time

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 02:02; SBBY 306; Huang 141; Fu 144; tr. Hawkes 210;

tls:text.tls:line: It grieved me bitterly that I could not see him.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 02:02; SBBY 306; Huang 141; Fu 144; tr. Hawkes 210;

tls:text.tls:line: I learned upon the chariot-board and heaved a heavy sigh,

sense.def: sigh (as a sign of hightened emotion)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 02:02; SBBY 306; Huang 141; Fu 144; tr. Hawkes 210;

tls:text.tls:line: And in a stream the tears ran down and wet the chariot-rail.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 02:02; SBBY 306; Huang 141; Fu 144; tr. Hawkes 210;

tls:text.tls:line: 15 I have fallen on dark, troubled times; I am lost and bevildered;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 02:02; SBBY 306; Huang 141; Fu 144; tr. Hawkes 210;

tls:text.tls:line: But though my private sorrow may be never-ending,

sense.def: unofficially, in a non-official way; for one's own personal purposes; in a way not defined by one's public obligations; in an unlicenced way,unofficially, personally, in an unauthorised way; privately and not on an official public occasion

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 03:01; SBBY 307; Huang 142; Fu 145; tr. Hawkes 210;

tls:text.tls:line: But I am grieved only by the chilly autumn.

sense.def: in polite speech: take the liberty of V-ing; humbly permit oneself to, humbly allow oneself to (NB 竊不敢...)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 03:01; SBBY 307; Huang 142; Fu 145; tr. Hawkes 210;

tls:text.tls:line: The tóng and catalpa trees will soon grow thin and bare.

sense.def: Chinese parasol tree; Eleococca; sterculia platanifolia???

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 03:01; SBBY 307; Huang 142; Fu 145; tr. Hawkes 210;

tls:text.tls:line: The tóng and catalpa trees will soon grow thin and bare.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 03:01; SBBY 307; Huang 142; Fu 145; tr. Hawkes 210;

tls:text.tls:line: 5 Gone now is the radiance of the bright sun,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 03:01; SBBY 307; Huang 142; Fu 145; tr. Hawkes 210;

tls:text.tls:line: And come the dreary watches of the longer nights.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 03:01; SBBY 307; Huang 142; Fu 145; tr. Hawkes 210;

tls:text.tls:line: And come the dreary watches of the longer nights.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 03:01; SBBY 307; Huang 142; Fu 145; tr. Hawkes 210;

tls:text.tls:line: Sore and withered, I am full of melancholy.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 03:02; SBBY 308; Huang 142; Fu 145; tr. Hawkes 211;

tls:text.tls:line: Stems are criss-crossed in confusion,

sense.def: branch of a tree; branches and twigs

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 03:02; SBBY 308; Huang 142; Fu 145; tr. Hawkes 211;

tls:text.tls:line: The tapering twigs are sad to see.

sense.def: small branch larger than a twig but smaller than a main branch (about the size useful for making an axe-handle...)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 03:02; SBBY 308; Huang 142; Fu 145; tr. Hawkes 211;

tls:text.tls:line: The tapering twigs are sad to see.

sense.def: wither so as to turn all brown

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 03:02; SBBY 308; Huang 142; Fu 145; tr. Hawkes 211;

tls:text.tls:line: The tapering twigs are sad to see.

sense.def: shrivel; wither and rot away; be rotten and completely dead

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 03:03; SBBY 309; Huang 143; Fu 145; tr. Hawkes 211;

tls:text.tls:line: 20 And grieve that I missed the time when I might have met my master.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 03:03; SBBY 309; Huang 143; Fu 145; tr. Hawkes 211;

tls:text.tls:line: Thinking to find some pleasure in idle wandering;

sense.def: be at ease; saunter; be carefree; roam; enjoy oneself; have a good time

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 03:04; SBBY 310; Huang 143; Fu 145; tr. Hawkes 211;

tls:text.tls:line: And have fallen on this mad and fearful age.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 03:04; SBBY 310; Huang 143; Fu 145; tr. Hawkes 211;

tls:text.tls:line: Slowly I pace or solitary stand,

sense.def: be limpid, tranquil and serene; be unperturbed; be placid (like the sea)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 03:04; SBBY 310; Huang 143; Fu 145; tr. Hawkes 211;

tls:text.tls:line: I look up to the bright moon and sigh,

sense.def: look up to (loan character for 仰)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 03:04; SBBY 310; Huang 143; Fu 145; tr. Hawkes 211;

tls:text.tls:line: I look up to the bright moon and sigh,

sense.def: sigh (as a sign of hightened emotion)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 03:04; SBBY 310; Huang 143; Fu 145; tr. Hawkes 211;

tls:text.tls:line: And walk underneath the stars until daylight comes.

sense.def: to pace (slowly); to walk along at measured speed; trot along;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 04:01; SBBY 311; Huang 144; Fu 146; tr. Hawkes 211;

tls:text.tls:line: 1 I grieve for the orchid blossoms thickly spreading

sense.def: in polite speech: take the liberty of V-ing; humbly permit oneself to, humbly allow oneself to (NB 竊不敢...)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 04:01; SBBY 311; Huang 144; Fu 146; tr. Hawkes 211;

tls:text.tls:line: 1 I grieve for the orchid blossoms thickly spreading

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 04:01; SBBY 311; Huang 144; Fu 146; tr. Hawkes 211;

tls:text.tls:line: 1 I grieve for the orchid blossoms thickly spreading

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 04:01; SBBY 311; Huang 144; Fu 146; tr. Hawkes 211;

tls:text.tls:line: That grow so gaily in the great courtyard.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 04:01; SBBY 311; Huang 144; Fu 146; tr. Hawkes 211;

tls:text.tls:line: Alas that these flowers should be without any fruits, [How come?]

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 04:01; SBBY 311; Huang 144; Fu 146; tr. Hawkes 211;

tls:text.tls:line: Alas that these flowers should be without any fruits, [How come?]

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 04:01; SBBY 311; Huang 144; Fu 146; tr. Hawkes 211;

tls:text.tls:line: And, fluttering, bow to every wind and shower!

sense.def: lift; be tossed up (by the wind); soar

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 04:01; SBBY 311; Huang 144; Fu 146; tr. Hawkes 211;

tls:text.tls:line: I was sad that my matchless thoughts could find no way to him,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 04:01; SBBY 311; Huang 144; Fu 146; tr. Hawkes 211;

tls:text.tls:line: And resolved to leave my lord and fly off high.

sense.def: fly to and fro, soar; hover

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 04:01; SBBY 311; Huang 144; Fu 146; tr. Hawkes 211;

tls:text.tls:line: My heart was grieved and sorely pained within me;

sense.def: feel miserable and despondent; (of things:) cause one to be miserable, be woeful, painful

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 04:01; SBBY 311; Huang 144; Fu 146; tr. Hawkes 211;

tls:text.tls:line: My heart was grieved and sorely pained within me;

sense.def: feel and show sharp and acute inner pain

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 04:02; SBBY 312; Huang 144; Fu 146; tr. Hawkes 212;

tls:text.tls:line: And they bar the way to him and will not let me through.

sense.def: bolt used to lock a gate from the inside

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 05:01; SBBY 313; Huang 145; Fu 147; tr. Hawkes 212;

tls:text.tls:line: They abandon the inked string, preferring their own guidelines;

sense.def: guideline; an abstract line (e.g. defining what is right and proper, or between what is legal and what is not)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 05:01; SBBY 313; Huang 145; Fu 147; tr. Hawkes 212;

tls:text.tls:line: They prefer to take the road whipping a broken nag.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 05:01; SBBY 313; Huang 145; Fu 147; tr. Hawkes 212;

tls:text.tls:line: They prefer to take the road whipping a broken nag.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 05:01; SBBY 313; Huang 145; Fu 147; tr. Hawkes 212;

tls:text.tls:line: They prefer to take the road whipping a broken nag.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 05:01; SBBY 313; Huang 145; Fu 147; tr. Hawkes 212;

tls:text.tls:line: 5 It is not that in this age there are no fine steeds;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 05:02; SBBY 314; Huang 146; Fu 147; tr. Hawkes 212;

tls:text.tls:line: The phoenix hovers distractedly, having no place.

sense.def: perch on; sit on, settle on; settle in (a place)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 05:03; SBBY 315; Huang 146; Fu 147; tr. Hawkes 212;

tls:text.tls:line: 15 I would willingly gag my mouth and say nothing,

sense.def: small branch growing immediately on the main trunk; minor branch

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 05:03; SBBY 315; Huang 146; Fu 147; tr. Hawkes 212;

tls:text.tls:line: Had I not once enjoyed rich favours from my lord.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 05:03; SBBY 315; Huang 146; Fu 147; tr. Hawkes 212;

tls:text.tls:line: The good steed lies hidden and will not show himself;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 05:04; SBBY 316; Huang 146; Fu 147; tr. Hawkes 213;

tls:text.tls:line: 25 If even birds and beasts know how to maintain their virtue,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 05:04; SBBY 316; Huang 146; Fu 147; tr. Hawkes 213;

tls:text.tls:line: 30 Even though I wish to be loyal, I have no means to show it.

sense.def: how? 焉得儉"How could he get to count as stingy?" 焉辟"how can one avoid?"

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 05:04; SBBY 316; Huang 146; Fu 147; tr. Hawkes 213;

tls:text.tls:line: But I dare not forget the great kindness he once showed me.

sense.def: in polite speech: take the liberty of V-ing; humbly permit oneself to, humbly allow oneself to (NB 竊不敢...)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 06:01; SBBY 317; Huang 147; Fu 148; tr. Hawkes 213;

tls:text.tls:line: Sleet and snow, thickly commingling, harder and harder come down,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 06:01; SBBY 317; Huang 147; Fu 148; tr. Hawkes 213;

tls:text.tls:line: Sleet and snow, thickly commingling, harder and harder come down,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 06:01; SBBY 317; Huang 147; Fu 148; tr. Hawkes 213;

tls:text.tls:line: 5 I wish that by some lucky chance I might be forgiven;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 06:02; SBBY 317; Huang 147; Fu 148; tr. Hawkes 213;

tls:text.tls:line: I wish I could set off unbidden and fly straight to him,

sense.def: of one's own accord, on one's own initiative, by one's own intention; intentionally

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 06:02; SBBY 317; Huang 147; Fu 148; tr. Hawkes 213;

tls:text.tls:line: But the road to him is blocked and impassable.

sense.def: be blocked, get isolated from what is important

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 06:02; SBBY 317; Huang 147; Fu 148; tr. Hawkes 213;

tls:text.tls:line: And so I stop midway in perplexity,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 06:02; SBBY 317; Huang 147; Fu 148; tr. Hawkes 213;

tls:text.tls:line: Grieving and hesistant; unable to turn back.

sense.def: control, keep under control; repress; hold down; hold back

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 06:02; SBBY 317; Huang 147; Fu 148; tr. Hawkes 213;

tls:text.tls:line: And though dull and stupid by nature and poor in talents,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 06:02; SBBY 317; Huang 147; Fu 148; tr. Hawkes 213;

tls:text.tls:line: And though dull and stupid by nature and poor in talents,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 07:01; SBBY 318; Huang 147; Fu 149; tr. Hawkes 214;

tls:text.tls:line: 1 I love the great spirit of Shēn Bāo-xū,

sense.def: in polite speech: take the liberty of V-ing; humbly permit oneself to, humbly allow oneself to (NB 竊不敢...)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 07:01; SBBY 318; Huang 147; Fu 149; tr. Hawkes 214;

tls:text.tls:line: 1 I love the great spirit of Shēn Bāo-xū,

sense.def: admire the beauty of; admire the moral qualities of; regard as beautiful, regard as wonderful

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 07:01; SBBY 318; Huang 147; Fu 149; tr. Hawkes 214;

tls:text.tls:line: They efface the marked lines and carve after their own fancy.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 07:01; SBBY 318; Huang 147; Fu 149; tr. Hawkes 214;

tls:text.tls:line: Wishing to take as my guidelines the pattern thought by the Sages.

sense.def: be full of admiration for (an ideal, a value, a thing); sometimes also: strive towards as one's main ambition; yearn for

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 07:01; SBBY 318; Huang 147; Fu 149; tr. Hawkes 214;

tls:text.tls:line: Wishing to take as my guidelines the pattern thought by the Sages.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 07:01; SBBY 318; Huang 147; Fu 149; tr. Hawkes 214;

tls:text.tls:line: To live in an impure world and be honored

sense.def: (in music or literature) muddy, impure; morally impure, defiled 濁世

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 07:02; SBBY 319; Huang 148; Fu 149; tr. Hawkes 214;

tls:text.tls:line: I love the spirit of that old poet:

sense.def: in polite speech: take the liberty of V-ing; humbly permit oneself to, humbly allow oneself to (NB 竊不敢...)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 07:02; SBBY 319; Huang 148; Fu 149; tr. Hawkes 214;

tls:text.tls:line: I love the spirit of that old poet:

sense.def: be full of admiration for (an ideal, a value, a thing); sometimes also: strive towards as one's main ambition; yearn for

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 07:02; SBBY 319; Huang 148; Fu 149; tr. Hawkes 214;

tls:text.tls:line: I love the spirit of that old poet:

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 08:01; SBBY 320; Huang 149; Fu 150; tr. Hawkes 214;

tls:text.tls:line: My springs and autumns are growing in number;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 08:01; SBBY 320; Huang 149; Fu 150; tr. Hawkes 214;

tls:text.tls:line: Sadly I lament my lot.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 08:01; SBBY 320; Huang 149; Fu 150; tr. Hawkes 214;

tls:text.tls:line: 5 The seasons come and go, making up the year;

sense.def: one after the other; taking turns, in due turn

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 08:02; SBBY 321; Huang 149; Fu 150; tr. Hawkes 215;

tls:text.tls:line: My heart is distraught; its passion increases:

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 08:02; SBBY 321; Huang 149; Fu 150; tr. Hawkes 215;

tls:text.tls:line: I am disappointed; I have nothing to hope for.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 08:02; SBBY 321; Huang 149; Fu 150; tr. Hawkes 215;

tls:text.tls:line: My breast is bitter with grief and anguish,

sense.def: feel sad and distressed, be melancholic

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 08:02; SBBY 321; Huang 149; Fu 150; tr. Hawkes 215;

tls:text.tls:line: And sigh after long sigh I heave heavily.

sense.def: sigh (as a sign of hightened emotion)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 08:02; SBBY 321; Huang 149; Fu 150; tr. Hawkes 215;

tls:text.tls:line: But I linger on here in uncertainty.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 09:01; SBBY 322; Huang 150; Fu 151; tr. Hawkes 215;

tls:text.tls:line: 5 I wanted the shining sun to come out in splendour,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 09:01; SBBY 322; Huang 150; Fu 151; tr. Hawkes 215;

tls:text.tls:line: I took no thought for myself, I wished only to be loyal;

sense.def: in polite speech: take the liberty of V-ing; humbly permit oneself to, humbly allow oneself to (NB 竊不敢...)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 09:01; SBBY 322; Huang 150; Fu 151; tr. Hawkes 215;

tls:text.tls:line: I took no thought for myself, I wished only to be loyal;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 09:02; SBBY 322; Huang 150; Fu 151; tr. Hawkes 215;

tls:text.tls:line: The noble actions of Yáo and Shùn

sense.def: resilient (behaviour), nobly independent; showing noble resilience

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 09:02; SBBY 322; Huang 150; Fu 151; tr. Hawkes 215;

tls:text.tls:line: Yet the pernicious jealousy of others

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 09:02; SBBY 322; Huang 150; Fu 151; tr. Hawkes 215;

tls:text.tls:line: Gave them a false report, calling them 'unkind'.

sense.def: artificial; pretended; fake, faked; pretending; faking

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 09:02; SBBY 322; Huang 150; Fu 151; tr. Hawkes 215;

tls:text.tls:line: Are often dimmed and have flaws upon them.

sense.def: reddish pattern in jade; flaw (in jade, occasonally also in the image of the sun etc)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 09:02; SBBY 322; Huang 150; Fu 151; tr. Hawkes 215;

tls:text.tls:line: 15 Then how much more the affairs of and entire state

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 10:01; SBBY 323; Huang 150; Fu 151; tr. Hawkes 215;

tls:text.tls:line: 1 A lotus-petal coat is bright and gay to wear,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 10:01; SBBY 323; Huang 150; Fu 151; tr. Hawkes 215;

tls:text.tls:line: 5 He hated the beauty of the truly noble,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 10:01; SBBY 323; Huang 150; Fu 151; tr. Hawkes 215;

tls:text.tls:line: 5 He hated the beauty of the truly noble,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 10:01; SBBY 323; Huang 150; Fu 151; tr. Hawkes 215;

tls:text.tls:line: When the farmer rests his plough and moves about in idleness,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 10:02; SBBY 324; Huang 151; Fu 151; tr. Hawkes 216;

tls:text.tls:line: When affairs of state are multiplied all for private ends,

sense.def: be selfish; be directed towards selfish ends; pursue selfish aims

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 10:02; SBBY 324; Huang 151; Fu 151; tr. Hawkes 216;

tls:text.tls:line: I fear that disaster is bound to follow.

sense.def: in polite speech: take the liberty of V-ing; humbly permit oneself to, humbly allow oneself to (NB 竊不敢...)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 10:02; SBBY 324; Huang 151; Fu 151; tr. Hawkes 216;

tls:text.tls:line: 15 Today you deck yourselves and preen before the mirror:

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 10:02; SBBY 324; Huang 151; Fu 151; tr. Hawkes 216;

tls:text.tls:line: Tomorrow you may have to creep away and hide.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 10:02; SBBY 324; Huang 151; Fu 151; tr. Hawkes 216;

tls:text.tls:line: Tomorrow you may have to creep away and hide.

sense.def: keep in hiding; go into hiding

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 10:02; SBBY 324; Huang 151; Fu 151; tr. Hawkes 216;

tls:text.tls:line: Now the sky above is all veiled by these floating clouds,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 10:03; SBBY 325; Huang 152; Fu 152; tr. Hawkes 216;

tls:text.tls:line: They were able to sleep sound and lead a life of ease.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 10:03; SBBY 325; Huang 152; Fu 152; tr. Hawkes 216;

tls:text.tls:line: They were able to sleep sound and lead a life of ease.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 10:04; SBBY 326; Huang 152; Fu 152; tr. Hawkes 216;

tls:text.tls:line: Yet I have accomplished nothing; I am without achievements.

sense.def: achieve (public and visible success) in the service of someone or something; realise; put into practice through commendable effort in some service

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 10:04; SBBY 326; Huang 152; Fu 152; tr. Hawkes 216;

tls:text.tls:line: Wearing myself out - a fool for righteousness!

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 10:05; SBBY 326; Huang 152; Fu 152; tr. Hawkes 216;

tls:text.tls:line: When Níng Qī sang beneath his cart,

sense.def: sing a song without musical accompaniment

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 10:05; SBBY 326; Huang 152; Fu 152; tr. Hawkes 216;

tls:text.tls:line: 45 Often I weep as I brood on these things:

sense.def: tears (perhaps with an admixture of snivel)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 10:05; SBBY 326; Huang 152; Fu 152; tr. Hawkes 216;

tls:text.tls:line: But the jealous came between us and screened me from his sight.

tls:text.tls:srcline: 願賜不肖之軀而別離兮，

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 11:01; SBBY 327; Huang 153; Fu 153; tr. Hawkes 217;

tls:text.tls:line: 1 Just grant me my worthless body and let me go away,

tls:text.tls:srcline: 願賜不肖之軀而別離兮，

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 11:01; SBBY 327; Huang 153; Fu 153; tr. Hawkes 217;

tls:text.tls:line: 1 Just grant me my worthless body and let me go away,

sense.def: leave, go away; go from one another

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 11:01; SBBY 327; Huang 153; Fu 153; tr. Hawkes 217;

tls:text.tls:line: 5 Bright rainbows darting swiftly in the traces,

sense.def: faded shadow around the rainbow; faint rainbow; rainbow

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 11:01; SBBY 327; Huang 153; Fu 153; tr. Hawkes 217;

tls:text.tls:line: I shall pass through the thick throngs of the powers of air:

sense.def: the soul of a deceased person (especially insofar as it is endowed with a supernatural efficacy); spirit; deity

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 11:02; SBBY 328; Huang 153; Fu 153; tr. Hawkes 217;

tls:text.tls:line: I shall return to see my lord free from all harm.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC JIUBIAN 11:02; SBBY 328; Huang 153; Fu 153; tr. Hawkes 217;

tls:text.tls:line: I shall return to see my lord free from all harm.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:01; SBBY 332; Huang 155; Fu 159; tr. Hawkes 223;

tls:text.tls:line: 1 (When I was young, I was pure and spotless;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:01; SBBY 332; Huang 155; Fu 159; tr. Hawkes 223;

tls:text.tls:line: 1 (When I was young, I was pure and spotless;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:01; SBBY 332; Huang 155; Fu 159; tr. Hawkes 223;

tls:text.tls:line: 1 (When I was young, I was pure and spotless;

sense.def: be impeccable; HF 6.3.31: be morally incorruptible, morally pure, morally scrupulous; honest

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:01; SBBY 332; Huang 155; Fu 159; tr. Hawkes 223;

tls:text.tls:line: 1 (When I was young, I was pure and spotless;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:01; SBBY 332; Huang 155; Fu 159; tr. Hawkes 223;

tls:text.tls:line: My body was imbued with unfailing righteousness.

sense.def: often reflexive: one's (own) person; one's (own) person and character; the Self; personality (as something cultivated by the gentleman); the character

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:01; SBBY 332; Huang 155; Fu 159; tr. Hawkes 223;

tls:text.tls:line: Entangled in the world's affairs, grew foul with neglect.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:01; SBBY 332; Huang 155; Fu 159; tr. Hawkes 223;

tls:text.tls:line: Entangled in the world's affairs, grew foul with neglect.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:01; SBBY 332; Huang 155; Fu 159; tr. Hawkes 223;

tls:text.tls:line: 5 Lacking the means to have this virtue tested,

sense.def: to submit to a close examination; to investigate strictly Shiji: 考信

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:03; SBBY 333; Huang 156; Fu 159; tr. Hawkes 224;

tls:text.tls:line: Deserting the place of your delight

sense.def: joyful satisfaction; state of delight or happiness; joyfulness; joy, delight; happiness;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:03; SBBY 333; Huang 156; Fu 159; tr. Hawkes 224;

tls:text.tls:line: to meet all those things of evil omen?

sense.def: inauspicious things, things of evil omen

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:04; SBBY 334; Huang 157; Fu 159; tr. Hawkes 224;

tls:text.tls:line: There are giants there a thousand fathoms tall, who seek only for souls to catch,

sense.def: this aforementioned N; the preceding N (is the one the SUBJECT VERBS) 敗是求 "it is defeat that you have sought"

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:05; SBBY 335; Huang 157; Fu 159; tr. Hawkes 224;

tls:text.tls:line: O soul, come back!

sense.def: male soul which returns to heaven;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:05; SBBY 335; Huang 157; Fu 159; tr. Hawkes 224;

tls:text.tls:line: There the people have tatooed faces and blackened teeth;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:05; SBBY 335; Huang 157; Fu 159; tr. Hawkes 224;

tls:text.tls:line: There the people have tatooed faces and blackened teeth;

sense.def: (normally human or equine etc) front teeth, tooth

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:05; SBBY 335; Huang 157; Fu 159; tr. Hawkes 224;

tls:text.tls:line: and pound their bones for meat paste.

sense.def: pickled meat without many non-meat additions

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:05; SBBY 335; Huang 157; Fu 159; tr. Hawkes 224;

tls:text.tls:line: There the venomous cobra abounds, and the great fox that can run a hundred leagues,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:05; SBBY 335; Huang 157; Fu 159; tr. Hawkes 224;

tls:text.tls:line: There the venomous cobra abounds, and the great fox that can run a hundred leagues,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:05; SBBY 335; Huang 157; Fu 159; tr. Hawkes 224;

tls:text.tls:line: There the venomous cobra abounds, and the great fox that can run a hundred leagues,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:05; SBBY 335; Huang 157; Fu 159; tr. Hawkes 224;

tls:text.tls:line: And the great nine-headed serpent, who darts swiftly this way and that,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:05; SBBY 335; Huang 157; Fu 159; tr. Hawkes 224;

tls:text.tls:line: And the great nine-headed serpent, who darts swiftly this way and that,

sense.def: GUOYU: (specifically) small and often poisonous snake; viper; generally: snake

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:05; SBBY 335; Huang 157; Fu 159; tr. Hawkes 224;

tls:text.tls:line: And swallows men as a sweet relish.

sense.def: gulp down (of liquids); swallow (food, or even a pearl); be large enough to be able to swallow

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:05; SBBY 335; Huang 157; Fu 159; tr. Hawkes 224;

tls:text.tls:line: O soul, come back!

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:06; SBBY 336; Huang 157; Fu 159; tr. Hawkes 225;

tls:text.tls:line: You will be swept up into the Thunder's Chasm,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:06; SBBY 336; Huang 157; Fu 159; tr. Hawkes 225;

tls:text.tls:line: And even should you chance to escape from that, beyond is the empty desert,

sense.def: V by luck, V through mere luck; be lucky to V, be lucky if one Vs, with luck; if we are lucky...

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:07; SBBY 337; Huang 158; Fu 159; tr. Hawkes 225;

tls:text.tls:line: dry stalks are the only food;

sense.def: this aforementioned N; the preceding N (is the one the SUBJECT VERBS) 敗是求 "it is defeat that you have sought"

tls:text.tls:srcline:
歸來兮！
恐自遺賊些。

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:07; SBBY 337; Huang 158; Fu 159; tr. Hawkes 225;

tls:text.tls:line: O soul, come back! Lest you bring on yourself perdition.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:08; SBBY 337; Huang 158; Fu 160; tr. Hawkes 225;

tls:text.tls:line: O soul come back!

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:09; SBBY 338; Huang 158; Fu 160; tr. Hawkes 225;

tls:text.tls:line: For tigers and leopards guard the nine gates, with jaws ever ready to rend 1í up mortal men,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:09; SBBY 338; Huang 158; Fu 160; tr. Hawkes 225;

tls:text.tls:line: For tigers and leopards guard the nine gates, with jaws ever ready to rend 1í up mortal men,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:09; SBBY 338; Huang 158; Fu 160; tr. Hawkes 225;

tls:text.tls:line: For tigers and leopards guard the nine gates, with jaws ever ready to rend 1í up mortal men,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:09; SBBY 338; Huang 158; Fu 160; tr. Hawkes 225;

tls:text.tls:line: They hang out men for sport and drop them in the abyss,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:09; SBBY 338; Huang 158; Fu 160; tr. Hawkes 225;

tls:text.tls:line: O soul, come back! Lest you fall into this danger.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:09; SBBY 338; Huang 158; Fu 160; tr. Hawkes 225;

tls:text.tls:line: O soul, come back! Lest you fall into this danger.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:10; SBBY 339; Huang 158; Fu 160; tr. Hawkes 225;

tls:text.tls:line: and his body is like a bull's.

sense.def: body as a whole; especially the main trunk as opposed to the head; body as embodying the person

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:10; SBBY 339; Huang 158; Fu 160; tr. Hawkes 225;

tls:text.tls:line: Lest you bring on yourself disaster.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:10; SBBY 339; Huang 158; Fu 160; tr. Hawkes 225;

tls:text.tls:line: Lest you bring on yourself disaster.

sense.def: OBI 5: disaster (from Heaven/Nature; occasionally self-inflicted as in CC 9.1); the reference is sometimes to a fire

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:11; SBBY 339; Huang 159; Fu 160; tr. Hawkes 226;

tls:text.tls:line: 55 Skilled priests are here who call you, walking backwards to lead you in.

sense.def: invocator, impersonator of the dead ancestor at prayer; person in charge of ancestral prayers; prayer-master

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:12; SBBY 340; Huang 161; Fu 160; tr. Hawkes 226;

tls:text.tls:line: High halls and deep chambers, with railings and tiered balconies;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:12; SBBY 340; Huang 161; Fu 160; tr. Hawkes 226;

tls:text.tls:line: High halls and deep chambers, with railings and tiered balconies;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:12; SBBY 340; Huang 161; Fu 160; tr. Hawkes 226;

tls:text.tls:line: High halls and deep chambers, with railings and tiered balconies;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:12; SBBY 340; Huang 161; Fu 160; tr. Hawkes 226;

tls:text.tls:line: High halls and deep chambers, with railings and tiered balconies;

sense.def: horizontal plank in a balustrade or fence; railings

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:12; SBBY 340; Huang 161; Fu 160; tr. Hawkes 226;

tls:text.tls:line: Stepped terraces, storied pavilions, whose tops look on the high mountains;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:12; SBBY 340; Huang 161; Fu 160; tr. Hawkes 226;

tls:text.tls:line: Stepped terraces, storied pavilions, whose tops look on the high mountains;

sense.def: terrace; square platform built on an earth-mound, raised platform 高臺

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:12; SBBY 340; Huang 161; Fu 160; tr. Hawkes 226;

tls:text.tls:line: Stepped terraces, storied pavilions, whose tops look on the high mountains;

sense.def: GY 17.5: wooden platform with pavilion, sometimes for military uses; later often overlooking the sea; building on a platform

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:12; SBBY 340; Huang 161; Fu 160; tr. Hawkes 226;

tls:text.tls:line: Lattice doors with scarlet interstices, and carving on the square lintels;

sense.def: one-wing door leading to a room; simple, ordinary door HF 入室閉戶 HF 蓬戶

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:12; SBBY 340; Huang 161; Fu 160; tr. Hawkes 226;

tls:text.tls:line: Beyond the hall, in the appartments, the ceilings and floors are vermillion,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:13; SBBY 342; Huang 161; Fu 160; tr. Hawkes 226;

tls:text.tls:line: Braids and ribbons, brocades and satins, fastened with rings of precious stone.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:13; SBBY 342; Huang 161; Fu 160; tr. Hawkes 226;

tls:text.tls:line: Braids and ribbons, brocades and satins, fastened with rings of precious stone.

sense.def: piece of elaborate string for use with hats etc; ribbon

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:13; SBBY 342; Huang 161; Fu 160; tr. Hawkes 226;

tls:text.tls:line: Braids and ribbons, brocades and satins, fastened with rings of precious stone.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:13; SBBY 342; Huang 161; Fu 160; tr. Hawkes 226;

tls:text.tls:line: Braids and ribbons, brocades and satins, fastened with rings of precious stone.

sense.def: undied silk; white silk (used e.g. for making hats)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:13; SBBY 342; Huang 161; Fu 160; tr. Hawkes 226;

tls:text.tls:line: Braids and ribbons, brocades and satins, fastened with rings of precious stone.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:13; SBBY 342; Huang 161; Fu 160; tr. Hawkes 226;

tls:text.tls:line: Braids and ribbons, brocades and satins, fastened with rings of precious stone.

sense.def: semi-circle of jade, typically worn on the waist. One of the liù yù 六玉 used in sacrifices to Heaven and Earth and the Four Directions, as well as in various formal court ceremonials. ILLUSTRATION

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:13; SBBY 342; Huang 161; Fu 160; tr. Hawkes 226;

tls:text.tls:line: Many a rich and curious thing is to be seen in the furnishings of the chamber.

sense.def: exquisite things that are conceived as primarily rare, extraordinary and as being of high aesthetic value

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:13; SBBY 342; Huang 161; Fu 160; tr. Hawkes 226;

tls:text.tls:line: Many a rich and curious thing is to be seen in the furnishings of the chamber.

sense.def: what is amazing and thus to be treasured

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:13; SBBY 342; Huang 161; Fu 160; tr. Hawkes 226;

tls:text.tls:line: Twice eight handmaids to serve your bed, each night alternating in duty,

sense.def: to take turns at an action

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:13; SBBY 342; Huang 161; Fu 160; tr. Hawkes 226;

tls:text.tls:line: Twice eight handmaids to serve your bed, each night alternating in duty,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:14; SBBY 345; Huang 162; Fu 160; tr. Hawkes 227;

tls:text.tls:line: Beauty and elegance grace the inner chambers:

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:14; SBBY 345; Huang 162; Fu 160; tr. Hawkes 227;

tls:text.tls:line: 80 Mothlike eyebrows and lustrous eyes that dart out beams of brightness,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:14; SBBY 345; Huang 162; Fu 160; tr. Hawkes 227;

tls:text.tls:line: Delicate coloring, soft round flesh, flashing, seductive glances.

sense.def: upper part of the face; countenance

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:14; SBBY 345; Huang 162; Fu 160; tr. Hawkes 227;

tls:text.tls:line: Of kingfisher feathers its purple curtains and the blue hangings that furnish its high hall;

sense.def: ZUO Xuan 17: area sealed off by curtains, tent (without roof) to prevent outsiders from seeing what is going on inside; certain

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:14; SBBY 345; Huang 162; Fu 160; tr. Hawkes 227;

tls:text.tls:line: Of kingfisher feathers its purple curtains and the blue hangings that furnish its high hall;

tls:text.tls:srcline:
紅壁沙版，
玄玉梁些。

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:14; SBBY 345; Huang 162; Fu 160; tr. Hawkes 227;

tls:text.tls:line: The walls, red; vermillion the woodwork; jet inlay on the roof-beams;

tls:text.tls:srcline:
紅壁沙版，
玄玉梁些。

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:14; SBBY 345; Huang 162; Fu 160; tr. Hawkes 227;

tls:text.tls:line: The walls, red; vermillion the woodwork; jet inlay on the roof-beams;

sense.def: the outer four walls defining a house; in military strategy: a temporary wall or blockade erected as a defense against the enemy

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:14; SBBY 345; Huang 162; Fu 160; tr. Hawkes 227;

tls:text.tls:line: 85 Overhead you behold carved rafters, painted with dragons and serpents;

sense.def: bending back (so as to look upwards), looking upwards

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:14; SBBY 345; Huang 162; Fu 160; tr. Hawkes 227;

tls:text.tls:line: 85 Overhead you behold carved rafters, painted with dragons and serpents;

sense.def: have a good look at, survey, have a look at and enjoy, visit to have a look at, sound out; poetically: gaze at

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:14; SBBY 345; Huang 162; Fu 160; tr. Hawkes 227;

tls:text.tls:line: 85 Overhead you behold carved rafters, painted with dragons and serpents;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:14; SBBY 345; Huang 162; Fu 160; tr. Hawkes 227;

tls:text.tls:line: 85 Overhead you behold carved rafters, painted with dragons and serpents;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:14; SBBY 345; Huang 162; Fu 160; tr. Hawkes 227;

tls:text.tls:line: 85 Overhead you behold carved rafters, painted with dragons and serpents;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:14; SBBY 345; Huang 162; Fu 160; tr. Hawkes 227;

tls:text.tls:line: Seated in the hall, leaning on its balustrade, you look down on a winding pool;

sense.def: horizontal plank in a balustrade or fence; railings

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:14; SBBY 345; Huang 162; Fu 160; tr. Hawkes 227;

tls:text.tls:line: Seated in the hall, leaning on its balustrade, you look down on a winding pool;

sense.def: artificial lake; winding pond surrounding a platform coming close in form to a moat; meandering lake (on the edges of Heaven)深池，曲池；天池

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:15; SBBY 346; Huang 164; Fu 161; tr. Hawkes 227;

tls:text.tls:line: Attendants quaintly costumed in spotted leopard skins wait on the sloping bank;

sense.def: the dignified, fine pattern a shape makes; dignified cultured appearance

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:15; SBBY 346; Huang 164; Fu 161; tr. Hawkes 227;

tls:text.tls:line: A light coach is tilted for you to ascend; footmen and riders wait in position.

sense.def: aristocrat's chariot with curtains to hide the passenger, a status symbol

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:15; SBBY 346; Huang 164; Fu 161; tr. Hawkes 227;

tls:text.tls:line: A light coach is tilted for you to ascend; footmen and riders wait in position.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:15; SBBY 346; Huang 164; Fu 161; tr. Hawkes 227;

tls:text.tls:line: A light coach is tilted for you to ascend; footmen and riders wait in position.

sense.def: horseman; knight; riding messenger; rider; outriders

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:16; SBBY 347; Huang 164; Fu 161; tr. Hawkes 227;

tls:text.tls:line: 95 Bitter, salt, sour, hot and sweet - there are dishes of all flavours:

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:16; SBBY 347; Huang 164; Fu 161; tr. Hawkes 227;

tls:text.tls:line: 95 Bitter, salt, sour, hot and sweet - there are dishes of all flavours:

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:16; SBBY 347; Huang 164; Fu 161; tr. Hawkes 227;

tls:text.tls:line: 95 Bitter, salt, sour, hot and sweet - there are dishes of all flavours:

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:16; SBBY 347; Huang 164; Fu 161; tr. Hawkes 227;

tls:text.tls:line: 95 Bitter, salt, sour, hot and sweet - there are dishes of all flavours:

sense.def: the pungent; what is pungent; the acid; what is acid

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:16; SBBY 347; Huang 164; Fu 161; tr. Hawkes 227;

tls:text.tls:line: 95 Bitter, salt, sour, hot and sweet - there are dishes of all flavours:

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:16; SBBY 347; Huang 164; Fu 161; tr. Hawkes 227;

tls:text.tls:line: Ribs of the fattened ox, tender and succulent;

sense.def: (primarily of animals, meat etc.) fat, rich; well-fed, sleek

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:16; SBBY 347; Huang 164; Fu 161; tr. Hawkes 227;

tls:text.tls:line: Ribs of the fattened ox, tender and succulent;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:16; SBBY 347; Huang 164; Fu 161; tr. Hawkes 227;

tls:text.tls:line: Ribs of the fattened ox, tender and succulent;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:16; SBBY 347; Huang 164; Fu 161; tr. Hawkes 227;

tls:text.tls:line: Geese cooked in sour sauce, caseroled duck, fried flesh of the great crane;

sense.def: wild duck (much appreciated as a delicacy); 妗挀� "tame duck"????

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:17; SBBY 349; Huang 165; Fu 161; tr. Hawkes 228;

tls:text.tls:line: 100 Braised chicken, seetheed terrapin, high-seasoned, but not to spoil the 190 taste;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:17; SBBY 349; Huang 165; Fu 161; tr. Hawkes 228;

tls:text.tls:line: 100 Braised chicken, seetheed terrapin, high-seasoned, but not to spoil the 190 taste;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:17; SBBY 349; Huang 165; Fu 161; tr. Hawkes 228;

tls:text.tls:line: Fried honey-cakes of rice flour and malt-sugar sweetmeats;

sense.def: cakes, delicacies[can also contain meat; in LIJI described as dumplings made by mixing beed, mutton and pork with rice][CA]

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:17; SBBY 349; Huang 165; Fu 161; tr. Hawkes 228;

tls:text.tls:line: Jade-like wine, honey-flavoured, fills the winged cups;

sense.def: LIKE A PRECIOUS STONE> precious, wonderful

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:17; SBBY 349; Huang 165; Fu 161; tr. Hawkes 228;

tls:text.tls:line: Jade-like wine, honey-flavoured, fills the winged cups;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:17; SBBY 349; Huang 165; Fu 161; tr. Hawkes 228;

tls:text.tls:line: Ice-cooled liqour, strained of impurities, clear wine, cool and refreshing;

sense.def: cool as water (in summer); be cool (as spring)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:17; SBBY 349; Huang 165; Fu 161; tr. Hawkes 228;

tls:text.tls:line: Here are laid out patterned ladles, and here is sparkling wine.

sense.def: beautifully patterned; beautifully adorned with flower patterns

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:17; SBBY 349; Huang 165; Fu 161; tr. Hawkes 228;

tls:text.tls:line: Here are laid out patterned ladles, and here is sparkling wine.

sense.def: general derived meaning: wine cup or wine ladle

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:18; SBBY 350; Huang 166; Fu 161; tr. Hawkes 228;

tls:text.tls:line: 192 'Before the dainties have left the tables girl musicians take up their places.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:18; SBBY 350; Huang 166; Fu 161; tr. Hawkes 228;

tls:text.tls:line: They set up the bells and fasten the drums and sing the latest songs:

sense.def: put firmly or securely in place

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:18; SBBY 350; Huang 166; Fu 161; tr. Hawkes 228;

tls:text.tls:line: They set up the bells and fasten the drums and sing the latest songs:

sense.def: make up; fashion, create; invent QIMINYAOSHU 蔡倫立意造紙

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:18; SBBY 350; Huang 166; Fu 161; tr. Hawkes 228;

tls:text.tls:line: They set up the bells and fasten the drums and sing the latest songs:

sense.def: new and fashionable; new and neat; newly come into existence (not: new in kind); OBI: newly built (For 新邑 compare "Newcastle" [sorry!])

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:18; SBBY 350; Huang 166; Fu 161; tr. Hawkes 228;

tls:text.tls:line: The lovely girls are drunk with wine, their faces are flushed.

sense.def: harem lady; beautiful lady; beautiful ladies

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:18; SBBY 350; Huang 166; Fu 161; tr. Hawkes 228;

tls:text.tls:line: The lovely girls are drunk with wine, their faces are flushed.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:18; SBBY 350; Huang 166; Fu 161; tr. Hawkes 228;

tls:text.tls:line: The lovely girls are drunk with wine, their faces are flushed.

sense.def: upper part of the face; countenance

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:18; SBBY 350; Huang 166; Fu 161; tr. Hawkes 228;

tls:text.tls:line: The lovely girls are drunk with wine, their faces are flushed.

sense.def: get red in the face after drinking wine

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:18; SBBY 350; Huang 166; Fu 161; tr. Hawkes 228;

tls:text.tls:line: 110 With amorous glances and flirting looks, their eyes like wavelets sparkle;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:18; SBBY 350; Huang 166; Fu 161; tr. Hawkes 228;

tls:text.tls:line: Dressed in embroideries, clad in finest silks, splendid but not showy;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:18; SBBY 350; Huang 166; Fu 161; tr. Hawkes 228;

tls:text.tls:line: Dressed in embroideries, clad in finest silks, splendid but not showy;

sense.def: be decorative, evenly patterned, beautifully patterned, symmetrically patterned; elegant and beautiful; be magnificent, be imposing (as the sound of a drum)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:18; SBBY 350; Huang 166; Fu 161; tr. Hawkes 228;

tls:text.tls:line: Their long hair, falling from high chignons, hangs low in lovely tresses.

sense.def: hair; human hair on the head

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:19; SBBY 352; Huang 167; Fu 161; tr. Hawkes 228;

tls:text.tls:line: perform a dance of Zhèng;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:19; SBBY 352; Huang 167; Fu 161; tr. Hawkes 228;

tls:text.tls:line: Their sleeves rise like crossed bamboo stems,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:19; SBBY 352; Huang 167; Fu 161; tr. Hawkes 228;

tls:text.tls:line: Pipes and zithers rise in wild harmonies,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:20; SBBY 353; Huang 167; Fu 161; tr. Hawkes 229;

tls:text.tls:line: 120 Men and women now sit together, mingling freely without distinction;

sense.def: come together, join up, arrive together 四方來雜，遠鄉皆至 “they gathered from the four quarters, and from distant parts they all met up"

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:20; SBBY 353; Huang 167; Fu 161; tr. Hawkes 229;

tls:text.tls:line: But the dancers of the Whirling Chǔ find favour over all the others.

sense.def: be scintillating, brilliant; be exquisite, fine

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:20; SBBY 353; Huang 167; Fu 161; tr. Hawkes 229;

tls:text.tls:line: 125 Sides are taken; they advance together; keenly they threaten each other.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:21; SBBY 355; Huang 167; Fu 161; tr. Hawkes 229;

tls:text.tls:line: Day and night are swallowed up in continuous merriment of wine.

sense.def: find one's happiness in; indulge in 娛酒

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:21; SBBY 355; Huang 167; Fu 161; tr. Hawkes 229;

tls:text.tls:line: Bright candles of orchid-perfumed fat burn in stands of delcate tracery.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:21; SBBY 355; Huang 167; Fu 161; tr. Hawkes 229;

tls:text.tls:line: In wine they attain the heights of pleasure and give delight to the near departed.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:22; SBBY 356; Huang 169; Fu 162; tr. Hawkes 229;

tls:text.tls:line: I stood on the marsh's margin and looked far out on the distance.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:22; SBBY 356; Huang 169; Fu 162; tr. Hawkes 229;

tls:text.tls:line: I stood on the marsh's margin and looked far out on the distance.

sense.def: into the far distance; from a far distance; in the far distance; into the distance

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:22; SBBY 356; Huang 169; Fu 162; tr. Hawkes 229;

tls:text.tls:line: The beaters' fires flickered skyward, and the smoke rose like a pall.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:23; SBBY 357; Huang 170; Fu 162; tr. Hawkes 230;

tls:text.tls:line: I trotted to where the throng was, and galloped ahead to draw them,

sense.def: to pace (slowly); to walk along at measured speed; trot along;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:23; SBBY 357; Huang 170; Fu 162; tr. Hawkes 230;

tls:text.tls:line: The King himself shot the arrow; the rhinoceros turned and fled.

sense.def: perhaps rhinoceros-like wild animal only tentatively identified by biologists, wild buffalo or ox of some kind, commonly mentioned and hunted already in OBI

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:23; SBBY 357; Huang 170; Fu 162; tr. Hawkes 230;

tls:text.tls:line: Marsh orchids cover the path here; this way must be too marshy.'

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC ZHAOHUN 01:23; SBBY 357; Huang 170; Fu 162; tr. Hawkes 230;

tls:text.tls:line: Marsh orchids cover the path here; this way must be too marshy.'

sense.def: this (concrete N) 斯子"this son"; often collective: 斯民 "these people", and never identifying: "this people"

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:01; SBBY 362; Huang 173; Fu 171; tr. Hawkes 233;

tls:text.tls:line: Dark winter frosts melt away. O soul, do not flee!

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:01; SBBY 362; Huang 173; Fu 171; tr. Hawkes 233;

tls:text.tls:line: Oh soul, come back! Do not go far away!

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:03; SBBY 363; Huang 174; Fu 171; tr. Hawkes 233;

tls:text.tls:line: In the south are a hundred leagues of flaming fire

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:03; SBBY 363; Huang 174; Fu 171; tr. Hawkes 233;

tls:text.tls:line: tigers and leopards slink;

sense.def: tiger- and leopard-like beasts; tigers and leopards

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:03; SBBY 363; Huang 174; Fu 171; tr. Hawkes 233;

tls:text.tls:line: There are monsters there that will harm you.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:04; SBBY 364; Huang 174; Fu 171; tr. Hawkes 234;

tls:text.tls:line: slanting eyes and shaggy hair,

sense.def: hair; human hair on the head

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:04; SBBY 364; Huang 174; Fu 171; tr. Hawkes 234;

tls:text.tls:line: Long claws and serrated teeth,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:04; SBBY 364; Huang 174; Fu 171; tr. Hawkes 234;

tls:text.tls:line: Long claws and serrated teeth,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:04; SBBY 364; Huang 174; Fu 171; tr. Hawkes 234;

tls:text.tls:line: and wild, mad laughter.

sense.def: put on a disdainful grinning grimace

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:04; SBBY 364; Huang 174; Fu 171; tr. Hawkes 234;

tls:text.tls:line: and wild, mad laughter.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:04; SBBY 364; Huang 174; Fu 171; tr. Hawkes 234;

tls:text.tls:line: and wild, mad laughter.

sense.def: be clinically crazy or mad; be intellectually malfunctioning

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:05; SBBY 365; Huang 175; Fu 171; tr. Hawkes 234;

tls:text.tls:line: And the Dài river that cannot be crossed,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:05; SBBY 365; Huang 175; Fu 171; tr. Hawkes 234;

tls:text.tls:line: whose depths are unfathomable;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:05; SBBY 365; Huang 175; Fu 171; tr. Hawkes 234;

tls:text.tls:line: And the sky is white and glittering, and all is congealed with cold.

sense.def: be bright and shining; be glittering

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:05; SBBY 365; Huang 175; Fu 171; tr. Hawkes 234;

tls:text.tls:line: And the sky is white and glittering, and all is congealed with cold.

sense.def: concentrate one's mind ZHUANG[congealed with cold][CA]

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:05; SBBY 365; Huang 175; Fu 171; tr. Hawkes 234;

tls:text.tls:line: O soul, go not to the north! There is no bourne there to your journeying.

sense.def: male soul which returns to heaven;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:06; SBBY 366; Huang 175; Fu 171; tr. Hawkes 234;

tls:text.tls:line: Enjoy yourself in your land of Chǔ, tranquil and untroubled.

sense.def: cause (oneself) to be unrestrained> give free rein to (oneself)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:06; SBBY 366; Huang 175; Fu 171; tr. Hawkes 234;

tls:text.tls:line: Number your days out in lasting pleasure, to old age, full of years.

sense.def: life-time; personal survival; one's life as an individual (as someting one might lose, or which might be endangered)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:08; SBBY 367; Huang 176; Fu 172; tr. Hawkes 234;

tls:text.tls:line: Fresh turtle, succulent chicken, dressed with the sauce of Chǔ;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:08; SBBY 367; Huang 176; Fu 172; tr. Hawkes 234;

tls:text.tls:line: O soul, come back! Indulge in your own choice!

sense.def: select (as a neighbourhood to live in); make a choice of; make a free and proper choice of, HF 6.3.30: choose freely (a ruler whom one wishes to serve)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:09; SBBY 368; Huang 177; Fu 172; tr. Hawkes 234;

tls:text.tls:line: Roast crane next is served, steamed duck and broiled quails,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:09; SBBY 368; Huang 177; Fu 172; tr. Hawkes 234;

tls:text.tls:line: Roast crane next is served, steamed duck and broiled quails,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:09; SBBY 368; Huang 177; Fu 172; tr. Hawkes 234;

tls:text.tls:line: Roast crane next is served, steamed duck and broiled quails,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:09; SBBY 368; Huang 177; Fu 172; tr. Hawkes 234;

tls:text.tls:line: Roast crane next is served, steamed duck and broiled quails,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:09; SBBY 368; Huang 177; Fu 172; tr. Hawkes 234;

tls:text.tls:line: Roast crane next is served, steamed duck and broiled quails,

sense.def: wild duck (much appreciated as a delicacy); 妗挀� "tame duck"????

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:09; SBBY 368; Huang 177; Fu 172; tr. Hawkes 234;

tls:text.tls:line: Roast crane next is served, steamed duck and broiled quails,

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:09; SBBY 368; Huang 177; Fu 172; tr. Hawkes 234;

tls:text.tls:line: Fried bream, stewed magpies, and green goose, broiled.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:09; SBBY 368; Huang 177; Fu 172; tr. Hawkes 234;

tls:text.tls:line: Fried bream, stewed magpies, and green goose, broiled.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:09; SBBY 368; Huang 177; Fu 172; tr. Hawkes 234;

tls:text.tls:line: 40 O soul, come back! Choice things are spread before you.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:10; SBBY 369; Huang 177; Fu 172; tr. Hawkes 235;

tls:text.tls:line: The singers chorus 'The Sunny Bank' to the music of Zhào flutes.

sense.def: sing (a song); sing about (a person, something)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:11; SBBY 370; Huang 177; Fu 172; tr. Hawkes 235;

tls:text.tls:line: Two teams of eight join in a dance to the chanting of poetry;

sense.def: OBI 4: dance (for rain); generally: dance (also occasionally said of animals like cranes)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:11; SBBY 370; Huang 177; Fu 172; tr. Hawkes 235;

tls:text.tls:line: 50 Bells and stone-chimes sound in unison as the musicians move into the luàn,

sense.def: knock at; strike against so as to make a sound

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:11; SBBY 370; Huang 177; Fu 172; tr. Hawkes 235;

tls:text.tls:line: And the four trebles blow with all their might as they enter the final modulation.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:12; SBBY 370; Huang 178; Fu 172; tr. Hawkes 235;

tls:text.tls:line: Ah, the vermeil lips and dazzling teeth, lovely and alluring!

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:12; SBBY 370; Huang 178; Fu 172; tr. Hawkes 235;

tls:text.tls:line: Ah, the vermeil lips and dazzling teeth, lovely and alluring!

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:12; SBBY 370; Huang 178; Fu 172; tr. Hawkes 235;

tls:text.tls:line: Ah, the vermeil lips and dazzling teeth, lovely and alluring!

sense.def: (normally human or equine etc) front teeth, tooth

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:12; SBBY 370; Huang 178; Fu 172; tr. Hawkes 235;

tls:text.tls:line: Ah, the vermeil lips and dazzling teeth, lovely and alluring!

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:12; SBBY 370; Huang 178; Fu 172; tr. Hawkes 235;

tls:text.tls:line: Ah, the vermeil lips and dazzling teeth, lovely and alluring!

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:12; SBBY 370; Huang 178; Fu 172; tr. Hawkes 235;

tls:text.tls:line: The uniformity of exellence, skilfull and imposing!

sense.def: urbanely beautiful; be beautiful in a refined way; stately, imposing

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:12; SBBY 370; Huang 178; Fu 172; tr. Hawkes 235;

tls:text.tls:line: 55 The well-rounded flesh and fine bones, elegant and pleasing!

sense.def: indulge in one's happiness; feel happily gratified

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:13; SBBY 371; Huang 178; Fu 172; tr. Hawkes 235;

tls:text.tls:line: And there are lovely eyes, flashing smiles

sense.def: smile in a beguiling manner (of women)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:13; SBBY 371; Huang 178; Fu 172; tr. Hawkes 235;

tls:text.tls:line: And faces of delicate refinement, glowing with the rosy flush of youth:

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:13; SBBY 371; Huang 178; Fu 172; tr. Hawkes 235;

tls:text.tls:line: And faces of delicate refinement, glowing with the rosy flush of youth:

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:13; SBBY 371; Huang 178; Fu 172; tr. Hawkes 235;

tls:text.tls:line: And faces of delicate refinement, glowing with the rosy flush of youth:

sense.def: be dignified, be elegant and handsome, be in the proper elegant style

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:13; SBBY 371; Huang 178; Fu 172; tr. Hawkes 235;

tls:text.tls:line: Beauty overflowing in abundance, goodness and grace to match it.

sense.def: upper part of the face; countenance

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:14; SBBY 371; Huang 178; Fu 173; tr. Hawkes 235;

tls:text.tls:line: Small waists and necks long and slender as golden xiān-bēi buckles.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:14; SBBY 371; Huang 178; Fu 173; tr. Hawkes 235;

tls:text.tls:line: Small waists and necks long and slender as golden xiān-bēi buckles.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:14; SBBY 371; Huang 178; Fu 173; tr. Hawkes 235;

tls:text.tls:line: Small waists and necks long and slender as golden xiān-bēi buckles.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:14; SBBY 371; Huang 178; Fu 173; tr. Hawkes 235;

tls:text.tls:line: Small waists and necks long and slender as golden xiān-bēi buckles.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:14; SBBY 371; Huang 178; Fu 173; tr. Hawkes 235;

tls:text.tls:line: Small waists and necks long and slender as golden xiān-bēi buckles.

sense.def: front of neck, throat; whole of neck

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:16; SBBY 372; Huang 179; Fu 173; tr. Hawkes 236;

tls:text.tls:line: Ah, the straight brows, jet in hue, the lovely eyes, large and lustruous!

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:16; SBBY 372; Huang 179; Fu 173; tr. Hawkes 236;

tls:text.tls:line: Ah, the straight brows, jet in hue, the lovely eyes, large and lustruous!

sense.def: attractive; wonderful; handsome, splendid, admirable; illustrious (name); elaborate and beautiful, lavish; of soil: be rich and good; of high quality; (also of sounds:) attractiveIn SJ & HS, 好女 and 美女 appear mainly as temptresses, gift objects that corrupt rulers; in this collocation, 好 and 美 would be "attractive." A very large number of females characterised simpl as 美 are prospective brides. 美 (but not 麗 ) is often used in connection with abstracta, such as deeds, words, customs and virtues. [JP]

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:16; SBBY 372; Huang 179; Fu 173; tr. Hawkes 236;

tls:text.tls:line: Ah, the straight brows, jet in hue, the lovely eyes, large and lustruous!

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:16; SBBY 372; Huang 179; Fu 173; tr. Hawkes 236;

tls:text.tls:line: 70 The dimpling cheeks and fine teeth, flashing in winning smiles!

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:16; SBBY 372; Huang 179; Fu 173; tr. Hawkes 236;

tls:text.tls:line: 70 The dimpling cheeks and fine teeth, flashing in winning smiles!

sense.def: smile in a beguiling manner (of women)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:16; SBBY 372; Huang 179; Fu 173; tr. Hawkes 236;

tls:text.tls:line: The well-rounded flesh and fine bones, the lithe and graceful limbs!

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:16; SBBY 372; Huang 179; Fu 173; tr. Hawkes 236;

tls:text.tls:line: The well-rounded flesh and fine bones, the lithe and graceful limbs!

sense.def: limbs including the head; also: body parts generally 四體，五體，百體

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:17; SBBY 373; Huang 179; Fu 173; tr. Hawkes 236;

tls:text.tls:line: The main hall is large and spacious; the audience chamber resplendent with scarlet woodwork;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:17; SBBY 373; Huang 179; Fu 173; tr. Hawkes 236;

tls:text.tls:line: The main hall is large and spacious; the audience chamber resplendent with scarlet woodwork;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:17; SBBY 373; Huang 179; Fu 173; tr. Hawkes 236;

tls:text.tls:line: A solar in the southern building rises high above the roof-eaves;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:17; SBBY 373; Huang 179; Fu 173; tr. Hawkes 236;

tls:text.tls:line: A solar in the southern building rises high above the roof-eaves;

sense.def: altar, sacrificial mound; high ground round a building used for ritual or sacrificial purposes

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:17; SBBY 373; Huang 179; Fu 173; tr. Hawkes 236;

tls:text.tls:line: And loggias run round about, and covered walks for exercising beasts in...

sense.def: covered walkway, covered corridor between buildings or around buildings

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:19; SBBY 374; Huang 180; Fu 173; tr. Hawkes 236;

tls:text.tls:line: 80 The gardens are stocked with peacocks; phoenixes too are found there;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:19; SBBY 374; Huang 180; Fu 173; tr. Hawkes 236;

tls:text.tls:line: The jungle-fowl chorus at dawn; bald crane are mixed among them; 214

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:19; SBBY 374; Huang 180; Fu 173; tr. Hawkes 236;

tls:text.tls:line: The jungle-fowl chorus at dawn; bald crane are mixed among them; 214

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:19; SBBY 374; Huang 180; Fu 173; tr. Hawkes 236;

tls:text.tls:line: Swans fly to and fro; green geese wander around.

sense.def: Pulleyblank: swan, Cygnus bewicki; Hightower: translates the yellow variety as heron

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:19; SBBY 374; Huang 180; Fu 173; tr. Hawkes 236;

tls:text.tls:line: Swans fly to and fro; green geese wander around.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:19; SBBY 374; Huang 180; Fu 173; tr. Hawkes 236;

tls:text.tls:line: Swans fly to and fro; green geese wander around.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:20; SBBY 375; Huang 1i2; Fu 173; tr. Hawkes 236;

tls:text.tls:line: Come the sleek, happy face, and lusty, sanguine health:

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:20; SBBY 375; Huang 1i2; Fu 173; tr. Hawkes 236;

tls:text.tls:line: Come the sleek, happy face, and lusty, sanguine health:

sense.def: blood energy> blood, physical energies; vital spirits

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:20; SBBY 375; Huang 1i2; Fu 173; tr. Hawkes 236;

tls:text.tls:line: 85 A body that will maintain fitness to ripe old age.

sense.def: body as a whole; especially the main trunk as opposed to the head; body as embodying the person

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:21; SBBY 375; Huang 1i2; Fu 173; tr. Hawkes 237;

tls:text.tls:line: 90 Watching over the young and meek, upholding the orphan and the widow.

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:22; SBBY 376; Huang 1i2; Fu 174; tr. Hawkes 237;

tls:text.tls:line: Your benignity falls on all classes of men; glorious are your rich favours;

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:22; SBBY 376; Huang 1i2; Fu 174; tr. Hawkes 237;

tls:text.tls:line: Dread goes before you; peaceful arts follow you; the beauty of your goodness is manifest.

sense.def: civil flexibility (as opposed to militarist severity)

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:24; SBBY 377; Huang 1i3; Fu 174; tr. Hawkes 237;

tls:text.tls:line: 105 O soul, come back, and let the state be ruled!

sense.def: 我國家the nation including its leading clans; our nation, my nation, the nation in question, the polity; their nation

tls:line.title: 楚辭(en)
tls:line.loc: CC DAZHAO 01:25; SBBY 378; Huang 1i3; Fu 174; tr. Hawkes 238;

tls:text.tls:line: The princes are all assembled; the Nine Ministers have taken their places;

sense.def: all; completely; exhaustively; all one after the other
